loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad, a 25 years old single guy, is the oldest among his three brothers and one sister. Muhannad has to work and study at the same time since he is the oldest. He wants to get a bachelor's degree. From his paycheck he sometimes gives an allowance to his siblings and pays some of the household bills after, of course, paying for his university fees. 

Muhannad is studying cooling and heating system. He wants to get the degree so he can find a suitable full time job or freelance work other than working part time jobs. He now has applied for this educational loan as he faces some shortage when paying the semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 36-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and six children, five of whom are in school. He has been in farming for the past fourteen years producing poultry, horticultural products, and maize which he sells at the local market in his area.

Fredrick is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. With the money he gets after selling the milk he will be able to uplift his living standards, provide milk for his children, and also use some of the money to pay their school fees. He aspires to own more dairy cows which will be able to produce fifty litres of milk per day in the next five years.

Animal feeds during dry periods and diseases are some of his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 31 years old.  She is a business lady who owns a grocery store. She is married and has been blessed with two children who are both in school. She has been in business for three years and also earns an income through farming. She is very responsible and hardworking  because she has to provide for her family. 
She hopes to expand her business, and she requires a loan of 68,799.38 KES to buy vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Luis Walter

texts.es:
Luis Walter tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos vive con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Luis Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor. "Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior porque le ha servido de mucho".
texts.en:
Luis Walter is 39 years old and is married with four sons. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the JERUSALEN community bank, located in Caimito I district, in the Puerto Pechiche parish of Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Luis Walter makes his living in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He is requesting a loan to buy pesticides, urea, liquid weed-killer and fertilizers. 

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers for his crops. He will buy the products he needs in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.
The challenges he faces are pests and bad weather. 

His dream is to buy a farm. In his free time he enjoys playing indoor soccer. He is very grateful for the previous loan because it has served him well.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, urea, liquid weed-killer and fertilizers.

loans.name: Al-Toahd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Altoahd. It is a peaceful group that consists of three women from Hodiedh, Yemen. Their main activity is small trade.

Asia is 36 years old and the mother of one child. She sells incense, perfumes and clothes to the women of the area.  She started her business when she was divorced by her husband.  This new loan will allow her to buy some incense and perfumes to mix various scents.  She hopes to open a retail store.

loans.use: to buy some incense and perfumes for her business

loans.name: La Bolita - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LA BOLITA – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Karina tiene 25 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de 3 añitos, ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos ella vende te cafés mates y sándwich  y otros en uno de los  mercados de la zona de Tembladerani,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Karina va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus desayunos como azúcar y te y café al por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Karina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que tiene en el mercado  en la venta de desayuno y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo y mejora de su puesto, su deseo para su negocio es tratar de comprar otro puesto y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Bank of Entrepreneurship LA BOLITA – 26 is composed of eight members, of which six are women and two are men. They make their livings doing different activities. The president of the Bank is Karina. She is 25 and has a three-year-old son. 

She makes a living selling breakfasts. She sells tea, coffee, yerba mate, sandwiches, and other things in one of the markets in the zone of Tembladerani. 

This loan is her first loan cycle within the Institution. Karina is going to use the loan to buy ingredients, such as wholesale sugar, tea, and coffee, for the preparation of her breakfasts.

The reason she is requesting this loan is that she lacks capital for the purchase of ingredients. Karina faces challenges in her business such as the competition she has in the market of breakfast sales, and she is going to use her profits to continue increasing her working capital and improving her sales stand. 

Her wish for her business is to try to purchase another stand and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, tea and coffee, for the preparation of her breakfasts

loans.name: Leny

texts.es: La Sra. Leny tiene 36 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 8 añitos que se encuentra en  edad escolar,   ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra la zona de Cañada el Carmen ,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Leny  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Leny va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Leny es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos para la manutención de ella y de sus hijito, el deseo de la Sra. Leny es el de tener un restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad a su clientes.
texts.en:
Leny is 36 years old. She has one son who is only 8 years old and so is school age. She sells food at her stall which is located in the Cañada el Carmen area. This is her first loan cycle in the institution. Leny will use this loan to buy supplies, such as rice, pasta and potatoes, wholesale. She will use these to prepare the dishes she sells at her stall. In this way, she can provide her customers with a variety of dishes. 

She is requesting the loan because she wants to continue improving her business. Leny will use the profits to buy more supplies and thus improve her income. Leny is a very hardworking woman. She is happy to have this opportunity as her stall is the only source of income she has to keep herself and her young son. Leny's dream is to have a restaurant which would be more comfortable for her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice, pasta and potatoes, wholesale

loans.name: Sandro Francisco

texts.es:
Sandro Francisco  tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Sandro Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas.
El sueño es seguir prosperando y acceder a más crèditos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver noticias y jugar indor. "Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior porque pudo comprar lo necesario para la agricultura".
texts.en:
Sandro Francisco is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Jerusalem communal bank, which is located in the rural settlement of Caimito I in Puerto Pechiche parish in Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Sandro Francisco is a farmer and grows corn and rice. He is asking for the loan to buy insecticides, urea, weed killer spray, and manure. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers for the crops.

He trades in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. The challenges he faces are infestations. His dream is to continue prospering and to obtain more loans. In his free time, he likes to watch the news and play indoor soccer. He is very grateful for the previous loan because he was able to buy what he needed for farming.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, urea, weed killer spray, and manure

loans.name: Annie Laurence

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, Annie Laurence est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 21ans et 16ans. Elle vend des pagnes depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Dans le souci d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Annie Laurence is 42 years of age, married, and a mother to three children who are at school. Her oldest child is 21, while the youngest is 16 years of age. She has worked for a number of years selling pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth], and gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to increase her supply capacity and cover her customers' needs, Annie Laurence has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. She will use this loan to maximize her business, as well as to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 30 pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elias

texts.fr:
Monsieur Elias, âgé de 45 ans, il est agriculteur des pommes de terre. Il a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est de trois ans de l’enseignement secondaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2011. Le crédit actuel lui est le deuxième et le premier est bien remboursé.
Avec ce deuxième crédit, il va acheter la semence, les engrais chimiques, les fumiers et paiera les ouvriers. La mauvaise condition climatique ou la perte de valeur des produits agricoles sont les seules difficultés de non remboursement qu’attend Monsieur Elias.  Pour accroitre son agriculture, il va utiliser les stratégies suivantes : moderniser son agriculture (en utilisant les engrais chimiques et fumiers), récolter après que les pommes de terre soient suffisamment murs, chercher les marchés. Comme ambition, il veut être un grand distributeur des produits agricoles, surtout les pommes de terre. Pour sa famille, il va améliorer sa maison d’habitation, scolariser ses enfants et acheter un véhicule.
A part d’agriculture, Monsieur Elias fait aussi l’élevage.
texts.en:
Elias is 45 years of age, and works as a potato farmer. He has five children, the oldest of whom is 24 and the youngest 10 years of age. All of his children are at school, and he has no other people under his care. Elias was born in Rwanda, and he studied three years of high school education. 

Elias started collaborating with ACB Ltd in 2011. This current loan is his second, and the first loan was successfully repaid. With this second loan, he plans to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers and manure, as well as to pay his labor expenses. 

The poor weather conditions and the loss of value of his agricultural produce are the only repayment difficulties that Elias faces. To increase his agricultural business, he plans on using the following strategies: to modernize his agricultural techniques (using chemical fertilizers and manure), to harvest the potatoes once they are sufficiently ripe, and to look for new markets. Elias' ambition is to become a successful distributor of agricultural produce, particularly potatoes. For his family, he will improve their home, ensure his children's education, and purchase a vehicle. In addition to agriculture, Elias also works raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and to pay his workforce.

loans.name: Jagabalia Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2006, 13 women from a village stepped out and formed a group named Jagabalia Self Help Group in Odisha. They help each other, share their problems and solve them together. They are celebrating their festivals together in their village.

Namita, leader of the group, has one cow. The lady standing fourth from the left in the photo wearing a red and black colored sari is Namita. She wants to purchase one new cow so that she can sell the milk in large amounts. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when it's required. She sells the milk  in her village with the help of her husband. Every morning, she takes the cow to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family.  She resumes taking care of her cow by feeding it at home. Her husband assists her in selling the milk and maintaining the cow. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.
	
She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase one more cow. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all the expenditure of her business. 

She has requested a loan of 195,000 INR for her group so that they can earn more and control their family's cash flow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Friscah

texts.en:
Friscah is 54 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She is a business woman who owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. 

She has been in business for four years and also earns an income through farming. She is very responsible and has learned how to save through the help of Faulu Kenya.

She wishes to expand her business and requires a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es: Eliecer, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado,  vive con sus 3  hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar una maquina de ordeño para una pequeña  lechería que posee. El se dedica  desde hace varios años a la ganadería y por lo cual decidió implementar en su proyecto esta nueva idea de la lechería.  El tiene pensado con este nuevo proyecto generar el máximo de las ganancias para estabilizar su economía y a su vez también ir generando los pagos de su crédito. El espera poder mejor la calidad de vida de sus hijos y esposa y tener para su futuro un ahorro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Eliecer is 45 years old and married. He lives with his 3 children and his wife who are his main priority.  With the loan, he intends to buy a milking machine for a little dairy he owns.  For several years he has earned a living with livestock which is why he decided to implement his project with this new idea of the dairy.   He thinks that with this new project he will generate maximum earnings to stabilize his financial situation and at the same time also to generate the loan payments.  He hopes to be able to improve the quality of life for his children and wife and to have savings for the future.  This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with the best terms and the lowest interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a milking machine.

loans.name: Badeea

texts.en: Badeea is a 53-year-old housewife and mother to 6 sons and daughters. Her children range from 19 to 31 years old. After her husband retired, he started working as a taxi driver to support his big family. Badeea makes baskets and trays using straw and hay and sells them. Now Badeea has applied for this loan to get more raw materials and buy more fabric.

loans.use: to get more raw materials and buy more fabric.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim has more than 15 years experience in the cattle business his parents own. They sell milk, cheese, and beef at a bazaar and in their local area. They also keep chickens at their farm. In addition, Rahim works as a construction worker. He is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. Rahim's and his family live with his parents and brother.  Rahim plans to buy land and build a house for his family and to start his own agriculture business. Today he has applied for the loan to buy one cow with calf.

loans.use: To buy one cow with calf.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is taking out a new loan to expand on his existing business. He is grateful for the support given which has made him prosper in life. He can now provide the majority of the basic needs for his family without any burdens to overcome.

Nixon is currently asking for a new loan to buy ingredients for his bakery. He is sure he will achieve good results, just as what he achieved with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 52-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children, who are all schooling. She has been in farming for over twenty-five years, producing tea, maize and peas, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 45,000 KES loan to buy dairy goats. From selling the milk, she will be able to get extra income to help her uplift her living standards and pay for her children's school fees. 

She plans to have bought two acres of land in the next five years.

Insecurity and the high cost of feeds are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 36, lives with her family: spouse and one five-year-old son. Naomi owns a store located in the front part of her living house, from which she sells a variety of groceries and household items. She is a very hardworking person who wants the best for her and her family's well-being. 

She is requesting a loan from Yehu to invest in the purchase of large quantities of products for the store. This would allow her to have more regular customers, a very good thing for any stable business. 

Naomi very much hopes to strengthen her business with more products, since this is what will help her to make a bigger profit and have a better life.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, basic grains, detergents, and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 53 years old.  She is married to Antony and they are blessed with six children aged  36, 33, 30, 25, 23, 20 respectively. She has been in business for six years, in which she earns 50,000 KES monthly.  She will use the loan to purchase more tea leaves for resale. 

She will use the profit to buy land and build rental houses.  This is her second loan, and she paid her previous loan successfully.  Her hope is to increase the stock for her business and to own a home.

loans.use: To purchase processed tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has one child. He owns a motorbike which he uses to transport people within his area. He previously worked as a bus driver. He has learned how to save his money and has grown financially since he joined Faulu Kenya.
 
He hopes to prosper in his business and move to the motor vehicle transport business. He requires a loan of 32,298 KES to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sanmartin De Tours Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es casada  tiene  47 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente, a la vez la socia vende lechón  los fines de semana  en su misma tienda de abarrotes siendo Huarocondo lugar caracterizado por vender este plato hecho a base de carne de chancho , la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como sacos de arroz para su negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de panadería, venta de maiz, tienda de abarrotes y a la venta de lechones (alimento preparado a base de carne de chancho).

Las personas  que salen en la foto adjunta son  socias que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These partner members belong to the community bank “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; This bank is located in the district of Huarocondo, which belongs to the province of Anta and the administrative division of Cusco. 

One member, Hilda, 47, is married and has four children. She alternates her daily activities in her business selling groceries. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, sodas, and more. 

She has been working in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into each day in her business. She works in the business from Monday through Sunday, from 6:00am to approximately 9:00pm. At the same time, she sells lechón (suckling pig) on the weekends in her own grocery store, since Huarocondo is a place that is characterized by its sales of this dish made with a base of pork meat.

She is a responsible and determined person, and she supports her family by being this way. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise, such as sacks of rice, for her grocery store.  

The other members work in a bakery, in corn sales, in a grocery store, and selling lechones (a dish prepared with pork meat). The people who appear in the attached photos are members who requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work commitments.

Hilda thanks those who are part of this dream, and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as sacks of rice, for her grocery store

loans.name: Meylin Auxiliadora

texts.es: Meylin de 45 anos de edad, casada con 3 hijos, del departamento de   Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Chinandega se caracteriza por ser un lugar comercialmente muy productiva. Con gente trabajadora, amable. Meylin tiene por actividad económica un bar y restaurante ubicado en su casa desde hace 16 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Meylin se caracteriza por ser una muy luchadora, de buenas costumbres, con ganas de superación personal. El Financiamiento lo esta solicitando para realizar mejoras a su negocio como modificar la cocina y comprar nuevas sillas. Con el objetivo brindar mejor servicio y atención a su clientela. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: arena, zinc. Cemento, perlines, pintura. Meylin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Meylin is forty-five years old, is married, and has three children.  She is from Chinandega, an area located in the Western part of the country.  Chinandega is characterized as being a commercial and very productive place with hard-working and kind people.  Meylin has a bar and restaurant located in her home.  She has been dedicated to this activity for the past sixteen years.

Meylin is characterized as being a fighting and well-mannered woman, with hopes of personal improvement.  The financing she is requesting is to improve her business by changing the kitchen and buying new chairs, all with the objective of offering better service to her customers.  With the financing she will buy construction materials, like sand, corrugated tin roofing, cement, purlins, and paint.  

Meylin is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to her and to other people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in construction materials, like corrugated tin roofing, sand, cement, paint, purlins, and to buy new chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in the suburbs of Faisalabad City in a two bedroom house with her husband and five children. She runs a small town grocery store. Twice every month Shehnaz stocks her shop with high demand products that she books at the wholesalers on a week’s notice. She is an ambitious lady who works hard to provide for her family. Her husband works in a private office but his income is barely sufficient to meet the family’s needs. Shehnaz borrowed funds from Kashf to invest in her business five years ago when it was almost at the verge of liquidation. She worked hard in her store and eventually sales increased. Recently she has requested for another loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of rice, flour, and sugar and packs of beverages. It will enable her to improve her sales which will help her bring in more cash.  Shehnaz says she wants to send her children to high school for further studies so they will never live in poverty like their mother.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, flour, and sugar and packs of beverages.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari business while her husband is a fisherman. Alma is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store such as dry goods, snack foods, and toiletries, and to buy fuel for the fishing boat. 
In the future, Alma wants to expand the family business and save money for reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store such as dry goods, snack foods, and toiletries, and to buy fuel for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a 40-year-old resident of Msambweni. He is married and a father of five children: two daughters and three sons. His wife takes care of the home. For the last 15 years, Hamisi has been fishing in the Indian ocean. He later sells his fish at the market. He says that he has achieved good results. He is taking out this loan to purchase fishing nets. He hopes to have more income and continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Bhakeswari Mahila  Samiti Group

texts.en: Satyabhama is 45 years old and has a child. She lives in the Balipatna village in Odisha, India with her husband and her child. A few years ago, she started a grocery shop where she sells rice, lentils, potatoes, wheat flour, onions, spices, soap etc. She purchases these items in the town with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of products depending on the demand in the village. She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafers, toilet cleaner etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting the loan with a group of 10 members who all are women who live in the same community.  They named their group Bhakeswari Mahila Samiti. They are located in the Khurda district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafers, toilet cleaner etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Shree Shree Hariharadev Self Help Group

texts.en:
Shree Shree Hariharadev Self Help Group (SHG) has 11 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The lady sitting third from the left in the photo is Rasmita, who is the leader of the group. Rasmita is 25 years old and married to a fisherman from Balugaon village in Odisha, India. Rasmita lives with her in-laws and her husband takes care of all the household expenses. She helps her husband sell fish. Her husband goes to the lake every morning to fish and she sells those fish in the market as fresh fish and keeps some of them to dry (Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated) and sells them as dried fish. Demand for dried as well as fresh fish is very high in the region. 

All the members of this group are engaged in selling fresh and dried fish in the market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demands, Rasmita and her group Shree Shree Hariharadev Self Help Group (SHG) has requested a loan of 165,000 INR to purchase fishing nets and storage boxes to keep fish. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchse fishing nets and storage boxes to keep fish.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She manages rental houses in Huruma Kwamaiko in Nairobi.

She has a good credit history with KADET LTD and she is now applying for her third loan of KES 100,000. She will use the loan to renovate her rental houses and purchase farm inputs for agricultural activity.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to build more rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate houses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old, married, and is blessed with three children. He has operated his business for the last six years and it gives him a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

He has a good credit history and is now requesting his third loan of 100,000 KES with KADET LTD. He intends to expand his shop by purchasing more stock of cereals,sugar, and cooking fat for sale.

The anticipated profits from his business will be used to support his family and to expand his retail shop to a wholesale store. He hopes that one day he will have multiple chains of stores all over the country.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, cooking fat, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 49-year-old married man. He has 4 children ranging from 6 to 15 years old. He describes himself as a decisive man. He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture such as tables, chairs, cupboards, beds, wall units, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a local residence and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of wood (raw materials) for making furniture. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy wood for making furniture to sell. His business goal is to expand his carpentry shop within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he can improve his family's standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim is forty-six years old and lives in a northern part of Kosovo. He is married and is a father of a five year old child. Agim provides transportation services with his van. He has been active in this business for eight years. His business and client base are growing steadily and he has a good reputation in the community.  

His customers are usually in his area and he has a lot of work because he is well known in his area. Agim's business is the only source of income for the family and he works hard to improve the lives of his wife and children. Recently his van broke down and Agim was unable to work and generate income. He is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle, to change the tires for winter-time, and to buy engine oil. Agim’s goal is to offer his family more comfort and to improve their standard of living. He is grateful to Kiva lenders and will continue to work hard to grow his business.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle, change the tires, and buy engine oil

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun is 28-year-old young man who lives with his wife and grandparents in Goris town. He works at a local company as a guard. As Harutyun is the only worker in the family, it is very difficult for him to sustain his family. Besides his work in the company, Harutyun is also involved in cattle breeding. He keeps 9 young pigs, a mother pig, and 40 lambs.  Harutyun has applied for this loan to buy 15 more lambs and expand his cattle breeding. This will help him to earn more income and continue development of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for 15 lambs

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 28 years old. He lives in the Akhalkalaki District with wife and two children (5 and 6 years old).  Edgar has requested a loan from a local financial institution several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Edgar used to have a mini-bus and transported cargo to the capital city. He was also involved in spice and seeds trading at the local open market, but the business was stopped because of financial problems. Edgar went abroad to find a suitable job there but his trip was unsuccessful and he came back to his district and decided to start a new business. Edgar purchased a well equipped store at the local open market and plans to set up a shoe store.

His loan request was approved by a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received loan Edgar will purchase a large variety of shoes as competition is high in the region and business won’t be successful if he doesn't have a wide choice.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase the family income and Edgar will be able to renovate his house, which is old and damaged.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo lives in the town of Msambweni. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. For the last five years, she has been operating a vegetable stall, selling at the market. Her customers prefer her stall because of her fresh products and above all her unequaled services.
Mwanakombo is taking this loan to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, garlic and kale. By doing so, she anticipates increasing the volume of her sales and earning a better profit.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, garlic, and kale.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 42-year-old housewife and is married to a public sector employee. They have three boys and one girl to support. 

As a help to support her family, Awatef buys used furniture and home appliances and resells them to others. Now she has applied for this loan in order to get more furniture and make a storage room for keeping it, other than in the yard in back of the house.

loans.use: to get more used furniture and make a storage room for keeping it.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 35 years old. She is married, with three children between the ages of 6 and 16, all of whom attend school. 

Rachel wants a loan to buy rice and cooking oil. She has been in business for the past 5 years. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Clara Jaqueline

texts.es:
Clara Jaqueline  tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Clara Jaqueline  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es comprarse un carro y una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly, indor y escuchae música. Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Clara Jaqueline, 37, is married and has four children.  She lives with her children and her husband in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She's a member of Jerusalén Communal Bank, located in the El Caimito I neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Clara Jaqueline makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weedkiller, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan she'll buy the fertilizer for the plantings.

She'll make her purchases in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  The challenges she faces are pests and bad weather.

Her dream is to buy herself a car and a farm.  In her free time she likes to listen to music and play volleyball and indoor soccer.  She's very grateful for the help from the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, weedkiller, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sujey Johanna

texts.es:
Sujey Johanna tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Rìos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Sujey Johanna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar agroinsumos, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. 
  
Las compras y las  las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca y una camioneta. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar basketh y el indor.

"Esta muy agradecido por el cedito anterior
texts.en:
Sujey Johanna is 32 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives with her children in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rìos province.

She is a member of the communal bank JERUSALEN, which is located in the Caimito region, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parrish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This solidarity group is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice, and Gandul bean planting.

Sujey Johanna has made a living planting corn and rice for five years. She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs, insecticides, urea, liquid herbicides, and fertilizers. With the help of the loan she can buy fertilizer for the crops. She will make these purchases in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rìos. The challenges she faces are plagues and bad weather.

Her dream is to buy herself some property and a truck. In her free time she likes to play basketball and indoor soccer. She is very thankful for her former loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, insecticides, urea, liquid herbicides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Alkadira Valeska

texts.es: La joven Alkadira de 24 años de edad, es casada actualmente no trabaja pero con el apoyo económico de su esposo se está preparando estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en administración de empresas ya que para ella obtener su titulo es muy importante porque le facilita nuevas oportunidades de empleo donde pueda desarrollar sus conocimientos obtenidos durante toda la etapa de la universidad, por esta razón ella solicita apoyo de crédito a Afodenic y Kiva para poder pagar su curso de titulación.
texts.en:
Alkadira is a 24-year-old young woman.  She's married and doesn't work right now, but with her husband's support she's getting ready to study for an advanced degree in business administration.  She wants to get her degree because it will open up new work opportunities for developing the knowledge she obtained in the university.

This is why she's requesting loan support from AFODENIC and Kiva to be able to pay the fees to register her degree.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register her degree

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a very devoted woman who always looks for opportunities to get ahead in life. She has a great testimony for the great achievement she has had since she started receiving loans from Yehu and Kiva. The previous loan had a very substantive impact on both her business and her living standards.

Agnes is asking for a new loan to expand her business. She would like to buy bales of clothing, cosmetics, and other beauty products so as to meet her customer orders. She is sure to have more income out of this investment.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Mila Rose

texts.en:
Mila Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat and spices vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell for her meat and spices vending business. Mila Rose has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Mila Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and other spices to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as an honest and intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located within a semi-urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Roena

texts.en: Roena is 68 years old. She is from a small village in the Mtskheta district. She lives with her husband. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Roena sells cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Roena also owns a plot of land, where she grows different kinds of vegetables. She is very hardworking and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Roena requested a loan to purchase building materials. After buying building materials she will be able to finish renovating her house. The renovation will improve their living conditions. Roena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating her house

loans.name: Methuselah

texts.en:
Methuselah is 32 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last twelve years, he has earned a living by operating a butcher shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He is applying for his second loan of KES. 40,000 to buy additional stocks of meat products, and dairy products, like yogurt, to sell beside the shop. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees, as well as to expand the business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can continue looking after his family by providing them with a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of meat products, and dairy products, like yogurt, to resell.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 43 years old, and from the small village of Supsa district, West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two daughters (3 and 6 years old). 

The family runs an agricultural business.  They have a cow and a calf, whose milk is used in dairy products. Lali also owns a plot of land, where she grows maize and nuts. Lali sells the harvested maize and nuts with the dairy products locally, and at a good price. She is very hard-working woman, and has rich experience in her business. 

Lali requested a loan for purchasing potato seeds and building materials for a greenhouse. She will sow different kinds of vegetables in the greenhouse, and increase the income of her family. With increased income, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and building materials for a greenhouse.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en: Fawzia is a 40-year-old housewife taking care of her three kids. Fawzia and her husband have a number of goats and use the goat's milk to make yogurt and cheese for sale. Now Fawzia is applying for this loan to increase the number of goats she has in order to increase the amount of milk she gets, and therefore increase her productivity.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and Henna for her business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms Shabana is 29 years old, and she lives in a one-bedroom house with her husband and daughter. When her husband failed to find employment, Shabana decided to use the skill her mother had taught her at a very young age and earn some money for her family. She started stitching for females in the neighborhood. She became famous by doing her fine stitching. 

In order to meet her orders on time, Shabana has requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR), which enable her to purchase material such as spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors. This will enable her to meet the growing demands of her customers, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.  Shabana is passionate about her work, and informed us that she is planning on preparing fancy dresses so she can sell them to retailers in the city Faisalabad.

loans.use: to purchase material, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 32 years old.  She has been selling clothes commonly known as Bitenge for four years. With the loan, she wants to add more bitenges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her future.

loans.use: buy dresses to sell

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Purificacion  tiene 58 años de edad, tiene un local alquilado donde realiza trabajo de gomería y venta de cubiertas   desde  el año 1970.
Debido a que lleva más de 40 años trabajando en esto, ya se hizo de mucha clientela, y es muy conocido por el buen servicio que da a sus clientes. Cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas con vehículos que mandan a realizar trabajos de gomería; y con este trabajo logro mejorar  su  nivel de vida y la de su familia.
El necesita de este crédito para la compra de herramientas que utiliza en la gomería, ya que las que tienen deben ser cambiadas para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Purificacion is 58 years old. He has a rented shop where he has been providing tire repair services and selling hubcaps since 1970.

Since he has been in business for more than 40 years, Purificacion has accumulated many customers. He is well-known for the good service he provides to his customers. There are many people who bring their vehicles to him whenever they are in need of tire repairs. Through the work he has achieved, Purificacion has been able to improve his standard of living and that of his family.

He needs a loan so that he can buy tools for performing tire repairs. His equipment needs to be replaced so that he can continue providing good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools for performing tire repairs.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four active women entrepreneurs in Bolangir town in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Mangala to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Nirasa is one of these women. The lady standing second from left, wearing a red shawl in the photograph, is Nirasa. Nirasa, 32 years old, is a very energetic lady who lives with her husband, one son who is 13 years old and one daughter who is 7 years old. The children are continuing their studies in the local school. 

Nirasa has been running a general store in the heart of the town for the last two years with the help of her husband. She sells items like biscuits, dust tea, oil, shampoo, toffee, and grocery items. She has been able to increase the variety of items in her general store by taking her first loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Her daily net income from the existing business is around Rs 400/-. With this income, her household expenses are in a deplorable state.  Nirasa purchases items from the local wholesaler twice a week. With the present loan, Nirasa wants to increase her stock by purchasing items like lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo etc. for her general store. This will help her to increase her income and  reduce the purchasing costs as she replenishes her stock frequently.  Nirasa hopes to save enough money to provide a better education to her children. 

The other three members of the group are Nurjahan, Saraswati and Baidehi. They run a water servicing center, sell vegetables at wholesale and run a Tiffin (lunch) pushcart.

loans.use: To purchase lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Najiya

texts.en:
Najiya is a 39-year-old, conservative married woman. She asked her husband, Khaled, to take her place in the photo.

Having seven children to take care of, as Najiya and Khaled have, is a big responsibility. For that, having a salary-paid job will not be enough to support the family. For that reason Najiya recently chose to start, with her husband, a scrap and recycled materials business. They collect the items from dumpsters and everywhere else, sort them in the back yard, and sell them to factories or other buyers. Now Najiya has applied for this loan, in order to get a new cart that will make the collecting process easier and more efficient.

loans.use: to get a new cart that will make the process of collecting materials to be recycled, easier.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en: Berthe is 37 years old. She sells fabrics and has been in the business for 17 years. She wants to use the loan to buy more fabrics to re-sell. With the profits from the business, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: la Sra. Carolina  tiene 47 años tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 27 y 24 años,  ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos de primera necesidad, electrodomésticos, ropa, sabanas y edredones a pedido, ofreciendo sus productos a crédito, ella no tiene un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos es distintos domicilios y mercados, la Sra. Carolina es cliente antigua ya que este préstamo es el  primero  que solicito en la institución,  la Sra. Carolina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos al por mayor,  la Sra. Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. Carolina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Carolina is 47 years old and has two children aged 27 and 24. She works in retail, offering a variety of basic commodities, electrical appliances, clothing, sheets and quilts upon request, offering her goods on credit. She doesn't have a fixed place of business, since she sells her products in various shops and markets. 
Señora Carolina is a long-standing client, but this is the first time she is requesting a loan with the organization. She is going to use this loan to buy wholesale electrical appliances. Señora Carolina faces certain challenges in her business, such as the demand for new products, She is going to put the proceeds towards better customer attention and buying a variety of products. Señora Carolina is pleased and grateful for the support provided by the organization in the granting of loans.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 41, lives in Sinkor with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 11 and 22. Her children are attending school. Annie has a restaurant in her community where she sells different kinds of food. She works six day a week. She prepares cassava leaves, palava, fufu, and soup for her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mayda Acela

texts.es: Mayda de 53 años tiene un negocio que consiste en la elaboración de trabajos en Foamy y lencería, como canastillas, toldos, toallas, cortinas etc. Ella también elabora calzado en épocas especiales como carnaval, navidad, temporada escolar etc. Su negocio lo inició, teniendo como fundamente su aptitud en las manualidades y su experiencia desde el año 1977, cuando participaba con una amiga suya en ferias,  haciendo arreglos florales en telas,  al cual adicionaron artículos para bebes y todo lo que hoy tiene que ve con la muñequería y el calzado. En la actualidad se prepara para acceder a un credikiva,  porque necesita estar invirtiendo continuamente debido a que tiene pedidos en muñecos de felpa, collares, sandalias, bolsos, tapetes y muchos otros artículos en lencería. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, foamy, hilo y accesorios, para adornar todo lo que haga. Sus principales clientes son los propietarios de pequeños almacenes en el centro de la ciudad, a quienes les vende de contado y a crédito y las amas de casa, que quieren tener sus viviendas bien adornadas con motivos nostálgicos navideños y/o necesitan dar sus aguinaldos a sus seres queridos y amigos. Su meta es lograr apoyar a su hija para que termine sus estudios profesionales; Mayda también desea superarse continuamente, para salir adelante con su negocio y beneficiar a su familia, a la que ama profundamente.
texts.en:
Mayda, 53, has a business that consists of the creation of craft foam and linen goods, such as baskets, canopies, towels, curtains, etc. She also makes footwear on special occasions such as Carnaval, Christmas, the school season, etc. 

She began the business herself, having as a foundation her ability to make crafts and her experience beginning in the year 1977, when she participated in fairs with a friend of hers, making floral arrangements on fabrics, to which they added baby goods and all the things that today have to do with dolls and footwear.

Today, she is preparing to access a Kiva loan because she needs to be investing continuously due to the fact that she has orders for plush dolls, necklaces, sandals, bags, mats, and many other linen items.

Her loan is the first financing Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will have done for her. With it she will buy materials and supplies such as fabric, craft foam, thread and accessories, with which to decorate everything she does. 

Her principal clients are small store owners in the center of the city, to whom she sells in cash and on credit, and housewives, who want to have their homes well-decorated for reasons of Christmas nostalgia and/or they need to give Christmas boxes to their friends and loved ones. 

Her goal is to support her daughter in finishing her professional studies. Mayda also hopes to continue to surpass herself, to move forward with her business and benefit her family, who she deeply loves.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies such as fabric, craft foam, thread and accessories, to decorate with

loans.name: Qendrim

texts.en:
Qendrim is 27 years old and married. He lives in a southern part of Kosovo. For more than eleven years he has worked as a mobile food seller in his area. During the summer he sells ice cream and in the colder season he sells chestnuts. Qendrim is a very hardworking person. He starts work early in the morning and does not finish until late in the evening. 
Currently he buys chestnuts wholesale and then he bakes them in his shelf and sells them for 50 cents per packet, which makes a lot of profit for him. He is asking for a loan of EU 600 in order to buy chestnuts at wholesale. The loan will help him increase his profit. As he said his profit is more than 50%. It is a very profitable business because he doesn’t need much equipment or have many overhead charges. He hopes in the future to expand his business and to start selling in different cities of Kosovo. Knowing that this is Kiva loan, he is very appreciative of all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy chestnuts.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Buchanan. She is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 6 and 18 who are in school and live at home. Her husband works with RIA. Martha has been selling clothes for the past three years in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Buenos días. Este es el Grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” conformado por 11 socios, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona y pasan al ciclo 13. Alicia tiene 28 años casada y con 02 menores hijos. Cuenta con una bodega la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 2 años. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Alicia ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. Su último crédito lo destinará como capital de trabajo, la cual comprara arroz, azúcar, leche y bebidas. El grupo  “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Alicia está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Good day. This is the “Unidos Para Triunfar” (United For Triumph) Group, which has eleven members, most of whom are neighbours who spent 13 years together.

Alicia is 28, and is married with two young children. She owns a grocery store offering basic goods. She has been working in this for over two years. With the fruits of her efforts, Alicia has managed to make improvements to her house and support her children's education. Her biggest wish is to continue improving her business. 

She will use her latest loan as working capital, to buy rice, sugar, milk and drinks. The “Unidos Para Triunfar” Group are grateful for the credit given since it makes their progress possible. Alicia is second from the right at the back of the photograph.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and drinks.

loans.name: Fermin's Group

texts.es:
El señor Fermin esta casado, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica ala agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de papa, inicio este trabajo con sus padres y hasta ahora lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien se dedica a lo sofii del hogar.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamos que sera utilizado, para la compra de abono orgánico, ya que solo así tendrá mejores cosechas de papas, espera mejorar su trabajo y en el futuro tener mucho capital y propio.
texts.en:
Fermin is married. He is 39 years of age. He completed 2 years of primary education. He has 6 children, 2 of whom are studying. He works in agriculture, specifically growing potatoes. He started doing this work with his parents, and now has 20 years’ experience. He has the support of his wife who takes care of the household chores.

He has organised a group in order to request a loan that will be used to buy organic fertiliser, as this gives the best potato crop. He hopes to improve his farming work and in the future to have a lot of capital and of his own.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to grow crops

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Buchanan along with her fourteen-year-old child that is in school.  Rebecca is 39 years old, married, and has been involved in a local soap making business for the past 13 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She is asking for a loan to buy more caustic and oil for her business.  Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more caustic and oil for her soap making business.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim is 31 years old. He is married and has two children ages four and eight years old. They all live in a village. His wife is housewife, staying home to take care of the children and the house. Two years ago Bekin began work in the agriculture business. 
Bekim needs EU 2000 to buy 10 sheep and to renovate his stable roof. The loan will help him cut some expenses like milk and milk products for his family. His goal is to expand his farm and to be able to sell the sheep as well to generate even more income. He hopes to offer a better life to his family. He promises to pay on time and is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and renovate his stable roof.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She has been in the wholesale business for two years now and it generates a monthly income of KES 34,800.

She has a good credit history and is now her third loan for KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase assorted accessories to sell at wholesale prices to her customers. 


The anticipated profits will be used to expand her business and she hopes that one day her business will grow to have over one million items in stock.

loans.use: to buy assorted accessories at wholesale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have seven children. She sells stoves and has spent five years selling stoves and saucepans. She has requested the loan to buy more stoves to re-sell. The profits from the business will be put into savings. Claudine is very thankful for her previous loan, which helped her greatly.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and cups to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has been in the fruit and vegetable business for the last 14 years and earns a monthly income of KES 23,800.

He is now servicing his second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to purchase two lorries of fruits in season to sell at wholesale. 

The anticipated profits will enable him to support his family and expand his business. He hopes that one day his business will grow and he will purchase a lorry for transport.

loans.use: To buy two lorries of fruit

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 63 years married and blessed with four children aged 15, 12, 7 and 3.  He owns a tailoring shop and has been in operation for the past 10 years earning an income of KES 20,000 monthly.  

He is now servicing his 10th loan of KES. 45,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully and intends to use this amount to purchase textiles for his business.  

The profits earned will be used to invest back into the business. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase textiles for his tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31. She sells “Bitenge," a type of local clothing. She wants the loan to add more Bitenge in her store. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more Bitenge for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He has been farming for the last eight years, and he grows onions and french beans. He is very hardworking and strives to always meet his targets and produce more onions and french beans. Faulu Kenya has helped him increase his production and also to learn to save his money.

He wishes to have five acres of land to cultivate on and also increase his farm produce. He needs a loan of 47,951 KES to buy manure, seeds, and chemicals for his onions and french beans.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and chemicals for his onions and french beans

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 34 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She operates a small cafe in Malindi where she earns a monthly income of about KES 7,500. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and, at the moment, she needs funds to purchase additional food stock such as wheat flour and cooking oil, and items such as serving spoons and more tea cups. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000. 

The anticipated income from the items purchased by the loan will help improve the financial status and living standards of her family and she will be able to help pay school fees for her children. Beth intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will own a well established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional food stock such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and items such as serving spoons and more tea cups.

loans.name: Ritag Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ritag. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.
Abeer is a 29-year-old married woman. She works hard so she can offer a good life to her family.
She is applying for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her home.
She hopes to open a home appliance store as a business to earn more profit and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her home.

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en:
Phoibe is 25 and single. She sells clothes, and has spent two years in the business. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for a better future.

She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Olsa

texts.en:
Olsa is 34 years old, a married Roma from south central Albania. She has two children; unlike others in their community, she chose to send them to school. She is proud of this, and considers it to be her major accomplishment. To support her family and most specifically to educate her children, she has been working next to her husband for all these past years.

Olsa has been a seamstress for the past 3 years, and the people she serves are her neighbors, and others from her community. In addition to this, she also sells used clothes and other items at the Roma market. 

Her oldest child, her son, has been accepted to a college and starts in January. She needs this loan to pay for his tuition fees. 

She will very much appreciate anyone’s financial help.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 30 years old and single.  He sells spare parts, and has been running the business for the past 7 years. 

With the loan, he will buy more spare parts for sale. He plans to use the profits to accumulate savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more parts for the bicycles and motorbikes spare parts business he runs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, especialmente ropa y calzado artículos que ofrece a crédito a una clientela que ha construido entre empleadas del servicio doméstico en Boca Grande un sector exclusivo de la  ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde vive con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo. Ella realiza la misma actividad que su madre quien está vinculada también ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y quien le enseñó todas las estrategias comerciales que ahora utiliza para generar ingresos con su negocio;  anteriormente Nora  había recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales invirtió en ropa y calzado, que vendió prontamente;  así su rentabilidad la aplicó a la compra de un colchón que necesitaba y medicinas para reforzar el crecimiento de su hijo y esto la hace muy feliz porque satisface sus necesidades familiares, junto a su cónyuge quien es vigilante de un edificio y también vende en el área donde se encuentra ubicado. Desde que recibió su crédito, su negocio creció amplió el número de sus clientes y aumentó su calidad de vida. Ella da sus agradecimientos a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por haberle facilitado el dinero a un mejor costo y por eso está aplicando a un primer credikiva, con el cual comprará  ropa y calzado, provisionándole a su clientela la ropa y el calzado a ccrédito, que su familia utilizaría en el mes de Diciembre época de gran derroche comercial y en la que la gente quiere vestirse elegante,  para recibir las navidades y el año nuevo unidos en su hogar.
texts.en: Nora earns a living selling various merchandise, especially clothes and shoes, articles which she offers on credit to a clientele that she has built among domestic service employees in Boca Grande, an exclusive sector of the city of Cartagena de Indias where she lives with her husband and her small son.  She performs the same activity as her mother who is also connected with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and who taught her the commercial strategies that she now uses to generate income with her business.  Previously, Nora had received two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she invested in clothes and shoes that she quickly sold and she applied her profits to the purchase of a mattress that she needed and medicines to strengthen her child’s growth. That made her very happy because she was able to satisfy her family’s needs, along with her husband, who is a security guard at a building and who also sells in the area where they live.  Since she received her loan, her business grew; she increased the number of customers and her quality of life improved.  She gives her thanks to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for having facilitated the money at a better cost and because of that she is applying for her first Kiva loan, with which she will buy clothes and shoes.  She will use what she purchases to supply her customers with clothes and shoes during the month of December, a period of great commercial spending in which people want to dress elegantly, so that her family can celebrate Christmas and New Year’s together in their home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La señora Doris tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos vive con ellos en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Hace 10 años que ella estableció una pulpería la que ha venido surtiendo poco a poco. Vende productos de limpieza y aseo personal, azúcar, arroz, harina, manteca, pastillas, pan, pastas, salsinas, verduras y otros abarrotes. Doris ha solicitado a ODEF  un tercer préstamo que  es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más productos como granos básicos, refrescos, carnes, verduras y otros de consumo diario para mantener surtido su pulpería. Con esta inversión va seguir incrementando las ventas y sus ingresos ya que su objetivo es tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She and her family live in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.

Ten years ago, Doris established a convenience store and was able to stock it a little bit at a time. She sells merchandise such as cleaning products, toiletries, sugar, rice, flour, lard, medicines, bread, pastas, sauces, vegetables, and other grocery items.

Doris is requesting her third from ODEF in the amount of 12,000 HNL. She will use the money to buy more products such as basic grains, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, and other daily consumables to maintain the inventory of her store. With this investment, she will continue to increase her sales and her earnings. Her goal is for her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, and other daily consumables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 6 to 14 years. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more firewood to sell. Her business goal is to open a retail store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Hekuran

texts.en:
Hekuran is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo. Before he opened his own café, Hekuran used to work as a DJ in another café. Three months ago he opened a café of his own. In his café, the consumers are mostly young people. His café has become famous very fast, and he has a lot of customers.
 
Hekuran needs to renovate -- that is, to paint, to buy pictures and other wall decor, and to buy tables and chairs to use in his café. The loan will help the atmosphere in the café and create a more comfortable and relaxing environment for his customers to enjoy. 

Hekuran’s goal is to save money and to offer a better life for his family. He hopes to expand his cafe in the future. He is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate his café, including painting it, buying pictures and other wall decor, and buying tables and chairs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 25, is married and has two young children.  She lives with her family in the municipality of Mombasa. Four years ago, Juliana decided to start selling omena (dry fish). She was motivated to start this business in order to contribute towards her home and attain economic independence. She sells at the market.

Juliana has requested a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish to sell.  She mentions that she’s very grateful for the financial support provided, because she will be able to improve her income, gradually grow in the business, and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Patience  S.

texts.en:
Patience, 29, is a high school student. She lives in Sinkor, with her husband and a child, who is 10 years old.  The child is in school. 

Patience has a table where she sells flour, butter, milk, sugar and eggs. She has done this for the past fifteen years. She learned to sell from her mother. She makes profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business, and she pays the educational expenses of her child. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, milk, sugar and butter, to resell in her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, flour and butter, to resell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is a fishmonger. Ama buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. Ama has been selling smoked fish for 10  years. She is married and has 5 dependents. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. Ama will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: purchase fresh  fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 29 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,500. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 to buy additional stock of dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts, etc to sell
