loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a businesswoman who owns a grocery store where she sells potatoes, peas, carrots and cabbage. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She also earns an income through farming and has been selling groceries for the last eight years. She learned how to save her money thanks to the financial help Faulu Kenya offered her. 

She hopes to own a retail shop in the future. She needs a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy potatoes, cabbage, peas and carrots.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbage, carrots and peas

loans.name: Ilaz

texts.en:
Ilaz is fifty six years old, married with 4 children. Together with one of his sons, he generates income by transporting goods. 

They all live in very poor, unsanitary, and unhealthy conditions. Their house needs to be renovated with basic things like doors and windows, and the roof is very old. Ilaz needs a loan to replace the roof, and to buy doors and windows.  He hopes that the loan will improve the living conditions for his family. 

Ilaz hopes to purchase the doors and windows as soon as possible, to avoid the extreme cold weather during the winter. 

In the future, he hopes that his children will be able to receive an education and have a better life. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To replace the roof, and to buy doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has 4 children. She sells crates of eggs, cassava, plantains, bananas, and groundnut in Elmina.  Efua uses her income to pay her children’s school fees.  Efua will use the loan to purchase crates of eggs, bananas, and a variety of fruit for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs, bananas, and a variety of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de Ciudad del Este, ella es soltera y vive con sus padres, ella está ejerciendo su profesión como odontóloga, en un local que ella alquila con sus propios ingresos.
Liz es una excelente profesión, y comenta que sus estudios están dando buenos frutos, pues su buen trabajado le ha dado la oportunidad de tener conformados sus propios clientes. Gracias al trabajo que está realizando ayuda con sus ingresos a su familia para una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su consultorio, ya que quiere seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Liz is from Ciudad del Este, she is single and lives with her parents. She works as a dentist, in a building that she rents with her own earnings.

Liz is a wonderful dentist, and says that her studies are bearing fruit, as her hard work has given her the opportunity to build up her own clients. Thanks to her work, she is able to use her earnings to help her family achieve a better quality of life.

She has proven herself to be very responsible and honest with her commitments. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her practice, so that she can continue to offer her clients a good service. She is grateful for this opportunity she is is being given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her dental practice.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba has been operating a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) for two years. The food she serves are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls.  She is married and has 4 children.   Araba uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  maize, cassava, bush meat, and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profits, Araba plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, bush meat, and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Sulley

texts.en:
Sulley is a food vendor. She sells Ga-kenkey (fermented corn dough cooked in corn or banana leaves) and serves it with okra soup and fish at Ampeyin, near Elmina. 

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a security officer. She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe her children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook her Ga-kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to make a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook her Ga-kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a food vender; she  sells  maize porridge, which she serves with bread and milk.  She is married and has 2 children.  

Esi has been in this business for 3 years.  Together with her husband, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children's school fees.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge, and the bread, to sell. With the new profit, Esi will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and porridge to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a baker from Elmina. She bakes pies for distribution to her customers. She is currently married and lives with her five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She responsibly supports her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, salt and other items to bake items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and other items

loans.name: Safi

texts.en: Safi is 30 years old. She sells “Bitenge” (local dresses), blouses and skirts. She wants the loan to add more bitenge and blouses to her store. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge and blouses to sell

loans.name: Wavinya

texts.en:
Wavinya is 48 years old. She is a married mother and has one school-age child. Her business is selling clothing, footwear and underwear for men, women and children. She has been in this business since 2008. 

Wavinya needs this loan to buy clothing and shoes for the winter season. She has made good sales and, as a result, her number of customers and the number of orders she receives have increased. This is very positive for her, as it means her income will increase and she will be able to provide her child with a decent life. She would like her child to finish their education and to be able to finish building her modest home.

loans.use: to buy winter season clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina, 32, is married and comes from vulnerable population community. She has two children aged two and four years old. Her husband works in a municipal job that earns him a very low salary. 

Jasmina grows different types of vegetables in her own greenhouse. She sells them from her greenhouse to others in her community in order to earn more money for her family. In the beginning her greenhouse was a small one, but she has since managed to increase its size. 

Jasmina is applying for a 2000 EUR loan from KosInvest to pay for another greenhouse and to buy more vegetable seeds. By expanding her vegetable business she can earn more in profits. She hopes to see it grow yet more. She is very happy to have the opportunity to receive this loan!

loans.use: To pay for another greenhouse and to buy more vegetable seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married to a fisherman and has two children. Ama sells soap and raw rice at Ampenyin, near Elmina. She has done this work for two years. She uses her income to assist her husband in feeding their children and paying the children's school fees. Ama will use her loan to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to resell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to resell.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta linda ciudad es originaria la señora Ana María García, una mujer muy esforzada con buenos valores morales. Es  madre soltera con una edad de 57 años y tiene una numerosa familia compuesta de siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente.

Doña Ana es obrera del tabaco de una fabrica procesadora de este rubro desde hace más de nueve años, con el salario lo destina para gasto de la consta básica del hogar, Ana cuenta con la ayuda económica de todos sus hijos ya que todos trabajan como obrero.

El crédito que solicita a ceprodel lo destinara para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena y cemento ya que va mejora el piso de su casa embaldosándolo; se siente con mucho animo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esteli el Diamante de las Segovia is the beautiful city where Ana Maria Garcia is from, a hardworking woman with good moral values.  She is a single mom, 57 years old and has a numerous family formed by seven children all adults and independent.

Ana is a tobacco journey-woman at a processing plant, has done this for more than nine years, with her salary she pays for the basic products needed in her house, Ana gets financial help from all her children who work as journeymen.

The loan requested to ceprodel is to buy construction materials such as sand and cement, to make renovations to the floor in her house; she is very hopeful about making betterments to her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Lumturije

texts.en:
Lumturije is a married woman from vulnerable population community. She has five children ages between 5 and 13 years old. Her husband works as musician who performs for weddings. They live in a small house with only two rooms. 

She is a very hardworking women and is always smiling, despite the fact that she lives in very bad conditions. Lumturije is in need of a loan to renovate two rooms because they are very old. This loan will improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes in the future to find a job in order to get more income for her children. 

She is very grateful for the opportunity and thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate two rooms

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama est âgé de 43 ans et vit dans une famille  polygame  avec son  épouse, il est père de 6 enfants et habite dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Du à des problèmes de famille, il a prématurément abandonné l’école et s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est basé sur  la vente de poissons fumés il y a plus de 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car Les poissons fumés sont les plus prisés à Koutiala.  Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il a décidé de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 3eme prêt individuel et les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Il s’approvisionne à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somonô et effectue sa vente au  marché poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 80 000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Adama is 43 years of age, and lives in a polygamous family with his wife. He is a father of six children, and lives in the town of Koutiala. Due to family problems, he left school early, and became interested in profit-making activities from a very young age. After several unsuccessful businesses, he now works selling smoked fish, and has done so for more than 10 years. He is well-known because the smoked fish he sells are the most sought-after in Koutiala. 

In order to be able to increase his working capital and strengthen his sales capacity, Adama decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He is now on his third individual loan, and his former loans were all successfully repaid. He gets his supplies in Korientzé, in the region of Mopti, from Bozo and Somonô fishermen. His sales are made in Koutiala fish market to male and female customers, on a cash and credit basis. 

With this financing, Adama hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay the interest on his Soro Yiriwaso loan and provide for his family. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells gari, a food made out of cassava, at Ampayin near Elmina. She has done this for two years.

Adjoa is married and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is married to a carpenter and has four children. She is a baker who bakes pastries to sell in Ampayin, near Elmina. She has done this for some time. Paulina uses her income to support her husband in paying their living expenses. She will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake her pastries. With her new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena cooks maize porridge for sale, along with bread and milk. She is married with four children. Meena has been in this business for four years. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children and paying their school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and porridge to sell. With the new profit, Meena  will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare bread and porridge to sell.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 36 years old and married, the father of three children. 

He has been working in shoe selling since eight years ago. He has special customer care, and he is smart and talented in dealing with all types of customers.

Samer is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower since seven cycles, with a good standing paying back history. He is very proud to deal with Al Majmoua, since it's the only NGO in Lebanon that supports Palestinians.  He attests that his previous loans helped a lot in increasing his income and developing his business.
Samer is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase his products with a new autumn-winter shoe collection.  Samer is looking to be able to travel  to China, importing products to start a wholesale trade in the future.

He hopes to provide for his family, especially his three children, giving them the best childhood and education ever.

loans.use: to increase his products with a new autumn-winter shoe collection.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a fishmonger at Ampanyi, near Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries and smokes them for sale. She has been in this business for some years. Yaa is married to a fisherman and has three children. Yaa helps her husband to feed and clothe their children. Yaa will use her loan to purchase more fish, which she will fry and smoke for sale. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and smoke for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a baker at Elmina. She bakes bread and pies for distribution to her customers. She is married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She supports her husband in educating, feeding and clothing their children. She will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for baking.

loans.name: Manaan

texts.en: Manaan sells doughnuts, spring rolls and local drinks at Elmina. The picture shows Manaan in the process of making spring rolls. She has four children. Her husband repairs electronic equipment. She responsibly supports her husband in advancing the well-being of their household. Her loan will be used to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar to make doughnuts and spring rolls for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business in order to open a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar to make doughnuts and spring rolls for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman. She sells clothes for both adults and kids. She has been in the business for ten years. The profits from the business will be used to create more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Né  vers 1980 à Ségou, marié et père de 2 enfants, Idrissa vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec ses parents dans la ville de Koutiala. Comptable de formation il est le gérant du dépôt pharmaceutique de son père depuis plusieurs ans.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il décide de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 4eme prêt,  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat de cartons produits pharmaceutiques auprès des pharmacies grossistes de la ville. Il effectue sa vente en détail au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.
Idrissa envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Idrissa was born in 1980 in Ségou. He is a married father of two, and lives in a traditional large family with his parents in the town of Koutiala. He is a trained accountant, and has worked for several years managing his father's pharmaceutical store. In order to ensure that his ever-increasing customer base remains satisfied, he has decided to seek assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and is on his fourth loan. This loan will be used to buy boxes of pharmaceutical products from pharmaceutical wholesalers located in his town. 

Idrissa sells on a cash and credit basis, and has a varied clientele. He plans to make a monthly income of 150,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay his loan and cover his family's expenses. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Née en 1983 à Koutiala, Sanata a 3 enfants et elle est la 3e femme de son mari.
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers de commerce : parures, habits, tissus, pagnes wax, draps de lit….
Nantie de 10 ans d’expériences, elle est très appréciée et sollicitée par sa clientèle.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les 2 prêts précédents, elle est à son 3eme , qui sera utiliser pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes wax et autres articles à Lomé (Togo). Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit, en ambulant et au marché, à une clientèle mixte.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sanata was born in 1983 in Koutiala, and has three children. She is her husband's third wife. She did not have the opportunity to continue her studies, but quickly became interested in profit-making activities, particularly the purchase and sale of miscellaneous items: linen, clothing, fabrics, pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using a traditional wax process, bed linen, etc. 
 
With her 10 years of experience, Sanata is recognized and in great demand among her customers. Having correctly repaid her two previous loans, she has requested a third, which will be used to buy 20 lengths of wax pagnes and other items in Lomé (Togo). Sanata sells on a cash and credit basis, on the street and in the market, and has a varied clientele. She plans to make a monthly income of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to cover the family's expenses. The rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using a traditional wax process

loans.name: Shohruhjon

texts.ru: Шохрухчону 21 год. Он очень успешный студент. Шохрухчон учится на 3 курсе Технологического Университета Таджикистана по специальности Международная экономика. Шохрухчон упорно занимается над своими знаниями. Он очень способный молодой человек и планирует стать будущим хорошим специалистом. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить в этом году за его учебу. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohruhjon is 21 years old. He is a very successful student. Shohruhjon is studying his third year at Technological University of Tajikistan with a major in International Economics. He's very dedicated to his studies. 

He is a very capable young man and plans to become a good specialist in the future.  His parents are not able to pay for his tuition this year. He is asking for a loan to pay for the school contract. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi lives together with the husband, a driver, and her two children at Ampanyin near Elmina. Esi is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them to sell, which she has done for five years . She is married with two children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. Esi will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. Esi plans to reinvest for further growth

loans.use: to purchase fresh  fish to smoke

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une grande famille polygame  avec son mari et leurs enfants dans  la ville de Koutiala.  
Aminata  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis son enfance auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle entama l’activité de vente de fary (des galettes à base d’haricot) depuis  plus de 5 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car  elle est sollicitée par tout le quartier. 
Pour l’amélioration de son activité, en stockant du haricot et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plusieurs ans.   Aminata   a obtenu des prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) auprès de Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement  remboursés et elle est à son 5eme  prêt individuel.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des cultivateurs des villages environnant de Koutiala, effectue la préparation et la vente de fary à Domicile. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 50.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aminata is 39 years of age, married, and the mother of six children. She lives in a large polygamous family with her husband and their children, in the city of Koutiala. She did not have the opportunity to go to school, and this is why she started working in trade with her mother from a very young age. 

After having several profit-making businesses, Aminata now works selling fary (biscuits made from beans), and has done so for the past five years. She is well-known because she is sought-after throughout the entire neighborhood.  To improve her business by getting stocks of beans, as well as to ensure customer satisfaction, she wasted no time in joining the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution several years ago. 

Aminata has obtained group loans from Soro Yiriwaso  in the past, all of which were repaid on time, and she is on her fifth individual loan. She gets her supplies from farmers in the villages close to Koutiala, and prepares her fary biscuits and sells them from home. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to pay interest on her Soro Yiriwaso loans and contribute to paying her family's daily expenses. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
People are always looking to better themselves. It doesn't matter when they do it because the goal is to get ahead and build a more prosperous future. That is the case with this young woman. She has great skills, and is honest, hardworking and enterprising. She lives with her family, who is her main source of inspiration. She wants to offer them a better life, far away from the crime that surrounds them.

For some time, she has had a small workshop where she makes and sells a variety of clothing for men, women and children such as shirts, blouses, dresses, and trousers. She does business every day and is well known in the area because of the way she serves them as well as product quality and good prices.

She wants to buy more fabric, lace, and thread, but does not have enough capital to do so. That is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, lace, and thread.

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth, Madre soltero con dos hijos de 14, 5 meses de edad, ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ruth tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consiste en vender ropa de niño, ropa de adulto, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos, short, ropa interior, perfumees, cosméticos. El  objetivo del préstamo en invertir en capital de trabajo aumentar su mercadería y de dicha forma incrementar su ganancia. Y también aprovecha las ventas en la temporada navideña  y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El negocio lo distribuye de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Ruth es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, sale a las calle a ofrecer mercadería donde clientes fijos y eventuales. Ruth agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother with two children, who are 14 years old and 5 months old. Se is originally from the Department of Chinandega, which is in the western region of the country. Ruth works buy selling general merchandise including clothing for children and adults, pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, perfume, and cosmetics. 

The reason for this loan is to invest in working capital to increase her merchandise and therefore increase her profits. She also takes advantage of sales during Christmas, and is able to meet her customers' demands. Ruth distributes her products by traveling. Her daily routine is to work ten hours a day. She goes out to the street to sell merchandise to regular and prospective customers. Ruth is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide help to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they may have a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to stock merchandise such as clothing for children and adults, pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, perfume, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader who sells vegetable and foodstuffs. At the same time, cooks banku to sell at Elmina. She serves her banku with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.  Esi is single and has three children. She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, vegetables and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to start a restaurant

loans.use: to buy bags of maize, vegetables and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Najeeb

texts.en: Najeeb is a 28-year-old, married man who has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a pharmacy, and he expends great energy to get profit so he can offer a good life for his family. He started his business with capital from his dad so that he could open his pharmacy. He applied for a youth loan of 200000 YER from AMB, which he will use to buy medicines for his business. He hopes to expand his pharmacy to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Alou Sanogo

texts.fr:
Agé de 29 ans, Alou a une épouse et est père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Alou est enseignant dans une école privée à Koutiala, en plus de cette profession il mène des activités de commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers de boutique et le stockage de céréales. 
Ces activités lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Alou a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs.  Il est à son  2e prêt  individuel qui sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises : cartons thé, de savon, des sacs de céréales et de sucres. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala KoKo à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alou is 29 years of age, is married, and is a father to three children. He lives with his family in the town of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso). He works as a teacher in a private school in Koutiala. In addition to this job, he also works in commerce, namely selling various store items and cereal stock. These businesses give him a fair amount of income, and he is often in demand and has many customers each day. 

To ensure customer satisfaction and to expand his business, Alou has sought assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to meet his goals. He is on his second individual loan, which will be used to buy stocks of different types of merchandise, namely boxes of tea and soap, bags of cereal, and sugar. Alou gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala, and sells on a cash basis in a store in Koutiala KoKo to a mixed clientele. 

With this expansion of his business, Alou hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay the interest on his Soro Yiriwaso loan and provide for his family. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of merchandise

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en: Yoramu is a father of seven children. They all go to school.  He is 49 years old. He sells foodstuffs such as beans and maize flour. With the loan, he wants to buy more beans and maize flour to sell. He wants to use the profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) in Abura.  Agnes is shown pounding fufu, which she has done for some years now.  The foods she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls. She is married with four children.  Agnes uses her income to support her husband and to pay their children's school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit,  Agnes plans to get a better place to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín de  55 anos de edad, soltero con un hijo de 9 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega el Viejo lugar que se caracteriza por la pesca  tiene por actividad económica el servicio de pesca artesanal, en el cual tiene 15 anos de tener dicho negocio. El negocio consiste en pescar todo tipo de marisco en general como langosta, pescado de exportación y blanco el producto que pesca se lo vende a los acopiadores de la zona para la exportación. El negocio lo aprendió del papa el cual se dedica a dicha actividad. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar equipo de pesca y renovar los existentes. Benjamín agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 55, single has a 9 year old son, he is from the department of Chinandega el Viejo; place known for its traditional fishing technique activity, business that he's had for 15 years.
His business involves fishing all types of seafood such as lobster, fish of exporting quality and the product he gets he sells to the distributors in the area who export it.  He learned his business from his dad who also works in this activity.  He needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and renew what he already has.  Benjamin is thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified way to live.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as nets.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 37 years old. She describes herself as happy, hard-working, and responsible with her children. She lives with her husband and their five children in the city of Mombasa, which is located in the province of Coast.

Frida has a grocery store that has been active for the past year. This is her first loan with Yehu. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt, flour, and other goods, which will allow her customers to have more variety. By taking this loan, Frida will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Frida dreams that she will continue to be supported by loans so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt, flour, and other goods.

loans.name: Custodia

texts.es: Custodia es una mujer multifacética, que en cada época tiene productos que vender ajustados a la temporada.  En los meses de Diciembre fabrica muñecos en su máquina y productos de lencería con motivos navideños, en carnavales productos asociados a esta fiesta y así sucesivamente. Ella también tiene una miscelánea donde vende múltiples mercancías como fantasías femeninas, ropa calzado papelería y agrega a esto el servicio de fotocopiaje, telecomunicaciones por minutos etc. Su idea emprendedora la inició desde el 2009 con el fin de agregar otros ingresos a los gastos familiares sustentados hasta ese momento solo por su cónyuge. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y habitantes del sector que encuentran en su negocio, además de una atención agradable y divertida, todo lo que ellos necesitan.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja durante 12 horas diarias, pues necesita crecer en ingresos, dándole respuesta a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará dulces, papelería recargas e insumos para fabircar sus lencerías. Con su credikiva responderá a la época mas bonita del año: la navidad, momento en el cual hay mucha rotación de dinero y las familias se preparan para tener adornos y artículos alusivos a esta temporada y es muy seguro que lo encuentren en la miscelánea de Custodia.
texts.en:
Custodia is a multifaceted woman.  At every time of year, she has different products that she sells according to the seasons.  In the months leading up to December, she makes dolls and linen products with her sewing machine for the Christmas season; during carnivals, she makes products associated with each festival, and so on.  

She also has a corner store where she sells multiple goods, like women's accessories, clothing, footwear, and stationary products, and she also offers a copying service, pay phones, etc.  She began this enterprising idea in 2009, hoping to add more income to cover the family expenses, which had, until then, only been supported by her spouse.

Her main customers are her neighbors and other members of the community who find, in addition to her thankful attention and fun personality, everything they need in her store.  

She makes her cash sales during the twelve hours that she works every day.  She needs to grow her income by responding to her clientele.  

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan.  This is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy sweets, stationary, phone cards, and materials to make her linens.  With her Kiva loan, she will respond to the most beautiful season of the year: Christmas, the time when there is a lot of money rotation and families prepare to have decorations for this season.  It is quite certain that they will find what they're looking for in Custodia's corner store.

loans.use: to buy sweets, stationary, phone cards, and materials to make linens.

loans.name: Noami

texts.en: Noami is 26 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a constructor; they have three children ages 3 to 10 years old. They live at home and attend school. For the past four years she has been operating a table where she sells palm oil. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives in Mombasa, Kenya with her husband. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. 

Edna has a food vending business, which she has been operating for four years. She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, baking powder, and food flavor. 

Edna's goal is to open a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, baking powder, and food flavor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, is a husband and father to two young children. With two shops in the community, he is a budding businessman. Peter's next aspiration is to own two Fresh Life toilets, which is why he has applied for a Kiva loan.

Peter would like to run two Fresh Life toilets because they are affordable, Fresh Life is a respectable brand in the community, and he would like to improve the sanitation of the environment in his neighborhood. Because he was never able to afford a formal education, Peter's dream is that profits from his Fresh Life business will enable him to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. She is grateful for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. Since the last loan, she has been able to increase sales and, hence, her overall income. She wants to make a new investment of capital in her business, so she is asking for a new loan. She will use it to buy bales of used clothing, to have a variety of items from which her customers can choose. She hopes to continue providing more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing, so she will have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 53 years old, married and has four children. All of her children have completed studying. She has been in business for three years and also practices farming to earn a living. She is a very responsible woman, and she has learned how to save since she joined Faulu Kenya.

Agnes wishes to expand her business and increase her profits. In order to fulfill her dreams, she requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy vegetables, bananas, potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 52-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 14 years to 24 years old. He describes himself to be jovial and a sociable man. He operates a carpentry workshop where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are residents from the environs, business people, etc. 

Tom describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of raw materials to make more furniture to sell. He will use the Kes 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his eight family members. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. In addition,Tom does farming; he sells farm produce to increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Janciline

texts.en: Janciline is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have six children. They all go to school. She sells "bitenge" (lengths of traditional fabric) and ladies' clothes and has been in that business for 14 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more 'bitenge' for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidoro vive en pareja con la señora Irma ambos tienen 59 años, y tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ellos, ya que los demás ya son todos mayores.
El Sr. Isidro tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa donde vende a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes bebidas en general, azúcar, arroz, panificados y otros insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar, además el señor Isidoro tiene una plantación de hortalizas en un terreno cercano a su casa, y de esa forma surte su negocio con verduras de una forma más económica para él.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de productos al por mayor, como ser carne, bebidas, enlatados y demás, ya que se acerca fin de año y desea aumentar su stock ya que en esa época suben el precios de los productos, y quiere poder mantener el buen precio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Isidro and his partner, Sra. Irma, are both 59 years of age. They have five children, but only one still lives with them. The others are already grown adults.

Sr. Isidro has a well-stocked food pantry in his home where he sells to his neighbors and occasional customers. He offers beverages, sugar, rice, baked goods, and other basic household necessities. In addition, Sr. Isidro plants vegetables on a plot of land near his house. By stocking his business with his own vegetables, he is able to generate a better profit.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk, such as meat, beverages, canned goods, and other items. With the end of the year approaching, he wants to increase his stock since prices go up during this time. He wants to continue offering affordable prices to his customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está felizmente casado, el es constructor de obras y dueño de una despensa en su casa, la cual atiende su esposa.
Comenta que ambos trabajan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, hay que saben que la vida es dura, y la única forma de salir adelante es por medio del trabajo que se hace. Cuenta que al principio fue difícil, pero que hoy en día van creciendo y ya tienen muy buena clientela.
Con miras a seguir creciendo el Sr. Miguel solicita de este crédito, ya que quiere ampliar su despensa, vendiendo ropas, e invertirá su crédito en la compra de prendas de todo tipo y así tener mayores cosas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the city of Encarnación, happily married, builder and owner of a pantry located in his house, which is manage by his wife. 

He says that both are working and striving to get ahead. They know that life is tough and the only way to get ahead is through the work they do. 

He point out that it was difficult at the beginning, but that today, the business has grown and already has very good clientele. With the intention to continue growing the pantry, Miguel requests this loan since he wants to expand by selling clothes. He plans to purchase clothing of all kinds and thus have larger inventory of products to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to expand his business

loans.name: Malinga

texts.en: Malinga is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children between the ages of 17 and 20. All of her children are in high school. She owns a hairdressing salon which she has been running for 12 years. She wants this loan to buy more products for her salon, including shampoo, as well as dreadlock, makeup and skincare products. Malinga will use the profits from the business to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.en: Dorothe is 44 years old. She is married with eight children. She has been selling fish and eggs to make a living, for the past 10 years. She wants to add more trays of eggs for sale, with this loan. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children, who are enrolled in various schools.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Al-Safa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Safa Group. It consists of 6 members who are all women. They are from Sana'a and they know each other very well. All their projects are home-based. However, they have many customers, mostly women. The group took a loan of 360,000 YER. 

Sabrin, the group leader, is a 28-year-old woman, who is a housewife. She acquired her profession of dressmaking long ago. Her main business is sewing, and due to her good reputation, she is able to attract more customers to her business. She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB, to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.es: Se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y Mirella se prepara para recibirla, surtiendo su negocio con articulos alusivos a estas temporadas; son tantas las personas que le compran que su negocio que no alcanza a responder a esta demanda y ella necesita invertir permanetemente para ser oportuna. En sus 4 años de experiencia, Mirella conoce como se mueve su mercado en cada época, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en una de las temporadas mas comerciales donde sus ventas se incrementan para aprovecharla y ganar mas dinero. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva pues comprará juguetería, ropa infantil, adornos navideños, cosméticos y utiles escolares, porque despues de la navidad viene el regreso a la escuela y desde ahora debe surtir. Ella vende de contado en su punto comercial, el cual abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde diariamente y  hasta mas tarde, si su clientela así lo requiere. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del sector y de barrios aledaños, que conocen y recomiendan el negocio de Mirella y usualmente compan allí, porque saben que ofrece lo mejor  y a un buen precio. La meta de Mirella es lograr independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar para apoyar la educación de  su nieta a quien ama y desa ayudar.
texts.en:
Christmas and New Year's are coming, and Mirella is preparing herself for the season by stocking her business with the necessary items. So many people are buying from her store that she isn't able to respond to the high demand, and she needs to invest permanently in order to take advantage of this period. 

Thanks to her four years of experience in this business, Mirella knows how the market moves with each season. Therefore, she came to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during one of the most commercial seasons, when her sales increase, in order to take advantage of this and earn more income. This is the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy toys, children's clothing, Christmas decorations, cosmetics, and school supplies. She should start stocking up on school supplies now, since children will go back to school after the Christmas holidays.

She makes sales in cash in her business space, which she opens from 8am to 6pm daily, or later if it is necessary for her clients. Her main clients are her neighbors in her area and from nearby neighborhoods, who know and recommend Mirella's business and usually do their shopping there, because they know that she offers the best products at a good price. 

Mirella's goal is to make her business independent from her living space in order to support the education of her granddaughter, whom she loves and wishes to help.

loans.use: To buy toys, children's clothing, Christmas decorations, cosmetics, and school supplies.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio, de 58 años es un hombre trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: David y Gisela, a los que cuida en la casa de su hermana donde vive desde hace 40 años. Tiene 34 años de experiencia en la agricultura, todos los días sale a verificar sus tierras de cultivo y su esposa es su principal apoyo; los cultivos principales que produce son papa, trigo, cebada y quinua. También se dedica a la crianza de animales de ganado ovino.  Sus mayores ingresos se ven en la siembra de los granos por lo que cada vez más el intensifica su siembra en estos productos. Muchas veces para él y su familia este es un trabajo agotador pero que se compensa con las ganancias que le permiten cubrir sus gastos además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia por lo que seguirá trabajando en esta actividad y mejorando la calidad de los suelos  cultivándola con abonos. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Eugenio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 58 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his two children, David and Gisela. He is raising his children in his sister's house, where he has lived for 40 years. 

He has 34 years of experience in agriculture. Every day, he goes out to check on his farmland. His wife is his main source of support. The main crops that he produces are potatoes, wheat, barley, and quinoa. He also raises sheep as livestock. His main income comes from sowing grains, so he continues to increase the sowing of these products. 

This is often an exhausting job for Eugenio and his family, but this is compensated by the earnings which allow them to cover their expenses. Additionally, there is always food for the family's own consumption, which is a great advantage for them. Therefore, Eugenio will keep working in this area and improving the quality of his fields by cultivating them with fertilizer. 

He has been working as part of a group with the communal bank "Productores Huancas" for several years, and this will be his twelfth loan with MFP. His perseverance is admirable, as he is one of the longest-standing members of the group. He continues to renew his efforts and his positive attitude.

Eugenio will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute in the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edson y sus 2 hijos: Jhon y Jhomar, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 27 años. Tiene 15 años de experiencia compartida con su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, cultivan primordialmente la  papa, trigo y cebada, junto con su esposo  comparten estas arduas tareas tanto en la época de siembra y cosecha, de esta manera  cuando se recoge la cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias sin intermediarios que por lo general  pagan un precio que no compensa el grande esfuerzo, Maruja  y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas por lo que desean aprovechar el campo que poseen para aumentar su ganado, pues posee 4 vacas de las que obtiene una buena producción de leche. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva. Maruja, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Maruja, 34 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Edson, and their two children, Jhon and Jhomar. She is raising her children in the house which she inherited 27 years ago.

She has 15 years of experience in agriculture, alongside her husband. The main crops which they grow are potatoes, wheat, and barley. She shares the arduous tasks with her husband during both the sowing and harvest periods. This ensures that, when they harvest their land, they can sell directly to merchants at the central market in their city. In this way, they can have a better income without intermediaries, who tend to pay prices that do not compensate for the farmers' efforts.

Maruja and her husband would like to continue with their work, so they wish to take advantage of the field they own in order to increase their livestock. They have four cows, from which they obtain a good milk supply.

Maruja has been working as part of a group with the "Productores Huancas" communal bank for several years, and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Her perseverance is admirable, as she is one of the oldest members of the group. She continues to renew her efforts and her positive attitude.

Maruja will invest this money in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: 22-Amanecer De Villa Tunari Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 22-AMANECER DE VILLA TUNARI está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. La Martha tiene 29 años y es soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  10, 8, 6  y 2 años, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de polleras para las cholitas, en su taller propio que se encuentran en zona Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela para la confección de polleras  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la gran demanda que tiene y la falta de capital para la compra de tela e hilos ya que tiene pedidos que entregar a distintos mercados, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de equipos y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de tela, La Sra. Martha es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en:
The Bank of Entrepreneurship 22-AMANECER DE VILLA TUNARI has eight members, of which six are women and two are men, who make their livings in different activities. 

The president of the bank es Martha, 29, who is single with four children ages 10, 8, 6 and 2. She makes a living sewing skirts for the "Cholitas" (members of a Bolivian indigenous movement) in her own workshop which is found in the Villa Tunari zone of the city of El Alto.

This is her first loan cycle within the Institution. Martha is going to use the loan to purchase fabric for the making of skirts. The reason she is requesting this loan is the large demand she has. She has orders to deliver to different markets, and lacks capital for the purchase of fabric and thread.

Martha faces challenges in her business such as the lack of equipment and sometimes a lack of material when they give her wholesale orders, depending on the work she has to do. She is going to use her profits to buy fabric.

Martha is a hard-working person whose wish is to have a big workshop and hire employees, and that way she can teach young people the trade of apparel making.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for the making of skirts

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama, 35, is a widowed mother of three children. Her children are between  the ages of 6 and 18. Two of her children live with their uncle; only one of them stays with her at home and is attending school. She received the initial capital from her father to start in this business.  She has been selling rice, palm oil, Vita, salt, onions, and cooking oil, at the community market for the past twenty years. 

Mama likes her business because with  her business she feels self-reliant. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods and pays back her loan. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice, Vita, onions, cooking oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to build house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, Vita, onions, and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a clothes business, which she has been operating for ten years. She has one child.

Aziza learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and occasional low business seasons. 

Aziza is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothing, e.g., clothes, shoes, and handbags. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her meet her family's needs, especially school fees. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: To purchase stock of second-hand clothing, e.g., clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Nelvis Judith

texts.es: Nelvis  de 35 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio de mercancías variadas en su domicilio ubicado al suroccidente de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. En su negocio vende utensilios de cocina, ropa interior, cubrelechos, sábanas medicamentos, multivitamínicos y productos de belleza principalmente. Ella tiene 2 años de experiencia en la actividad comercial,  desde que decidió apoyar la gestión de ingresos que hasta ese momento estaban a cargo de su cónyuge casi en su totalidad, pues había estudiado auxiliar de enfermería  y solo contaba con trabajos provisionales. Los productos que vende,  los promociona a través de visitas a nuevos clientes y haciendo preventa a antiguos, que le envían referidos para apoyarla en su gestión empresarial. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito, teniendo en cuenta la capacidad de pago de su clientela y la posibilidad de sus cuotas mensuales, semanales de acuerdo a la frecuencia que pacte con cada uno de ellos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar cada vez más el bienestar de su familia. En la actualidad requiere ampliar su capital de trabajo por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa interior, ropa exterior, medicamentos, multiusos y adornos navideños, con los cuales responderá a los pedidos de sus clientes, que tomó en su preventa y le ayudará a generar mas ingresos, lo cual es la razón de éxito de su inversión de credikiva.
texts.en:
Nelvis is 35 years old and makes a living selling various goods from her home, located in the southwest of her city. She lives with her spouse and 5-year-old son. 

In her business, she mainly sells kitchen utensils, undergarments, bedspreads, sheets, medications, multivitamins, and beauty products. She has two years of experience in the commercial sector, since the moment when she decided to support the management of the family income. Until that point, this had been almost completely the responsibility of her spouse. She had studied to be a nurses' aid, and she only had temporary jobs. 

She markets the products which she sells by making visits to new clients and offering pre-sales to returning clients, who send her referrals to help her manage her business.

She makes her purchases on credit, taking into account the ability of her clients to pay and the possibilities of monthly and weekly payments, according to the frequency which has been agreed upon.

Her goal is to expand her business in order to increase her profits and to continually support the wellbeing of her family. She currently needs to expand her working capital, which is why she has applied for a Kiva loan. 

This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy undergarments, outerwear, medications, multi-use products and Christmas decorations. She will then be able to satisfy the orders of her clients, which she took during her pre-sale and which will help her to generate more income. This will allow her to achieve success with the investment from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, outerwear, medication, multi-use products, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: La Buena Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group La Buena Fe ("The Good Faith") 1 & 2. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, a sleepy agricultural town. The group comprises ten micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling different products. Marta makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five children.

Marta is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She intends to use the loan capital to purchase cosmetics, rings, chains, bracelets, and other jewelry. She will use the profits to save, because she needs to finish building her home and invest in her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 23-year-old woman. She has been married for a short period of time. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover their needs.

Tamam is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. She will use the loan to buy new living room and dining room furniture, in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Tamam and her husband comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

Tamam and her husband are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the home she is making with her new husband.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née à Bamako, Korotoumou est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de faire des longues études, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de tissus, chaussures et autres depuis plusieurs ans. Korotoumou est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a plus de 2 ans. Elle est à son 3e prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des stocks de marchandises constitués deux rouleaux de tissus, une douzaine de paires de chaussures et 10 draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, participer aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Born in Bamako, Korotoumou is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children.  She lives with her husband and her children in Koutiala, in the Sikasso region.

Korotoumou did not have the opportunity to attend school for many years, which explains her current interest in income-generating activities (such as buying and selling fabrics, shoes and others).  She has actually been involved in this activity for several years and her goods are in high demand from her customers.

In order to increase the size of her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago.  This is her third individual loan; her past two loans were duly repaid.

With this new loan, she is planning to replenish her stock of goods and buy two rolls of fabrics, a dozen pairs of shoes and ten bedsheets.  She stocks up in Burkina Faso and sells in the city of Koutiala, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base which generally consists of women.

She is expecting monthly profits to reach 80,000 CFA francs.  She will use these profits to pay back her loan, contribute to the daily expenses of her family, and, with the rest of the money, continue her activity.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and bedsheets.

loans.name: Meiva

texts.es:
Meiva  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres compartiendo todas las dependencias, ella cuenta con un ambiente el cual es su dormitorio, la casa es de sus padres es de ladrillo y el piso es de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada, supervisora en ventas de una agencia de viajes donde percibe un salario mensual que cubre sus necesidades de transporte y alimentación. Ella  está estudiando en una de las universidades  de la ciudad de La Paz donde se encuentra en el tercer año de la carrera de turismo. El crédito quiere para la compra de una computadora portátil para realizar sus trabajos universitarios y mejorar sus estudios.
El sueño de Meiva es culminar sus estudios y así poder trabajar realizando viajes al exterior y conocer otras costumbres y así poder independizare de su familia..
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Meiva is single and has no children. She lives in her parents house, sharing all the rooms.  She has her own room, which is her bedroom. Her parents' home is made of brick with a cement floor, and is located in the Llojeta Bajo area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she is employed as a sales supervisor for travel agency, where she earns a monthly salary that covers her transportation and food needs. She is studying at one of the universities in the city of La Paz, where she is in the third year of the tourism degree program. 

She wants the loan in order to buy a laptop computer, so that she can do her university work and improve in her studies. Meiva's dream is to complete her education and to be able to work making trips to other countries; to get to know other ways of life, and be able to be independent from her family.

This is the first time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer that will help her with her tourism studies at the university.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose, tiene 21 años, es soltero, reside en el municipio de Morazan, Departamento de Yoro. Jose, tiene su propio taller de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas y mototaxis. Lo estableció hace dos años 5 meses en un local alquilado. Anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de este rubro y fue allí donde aprendió muy bien este oficio. El está solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar herramientas,repuestos, aceites, grasas y aditivos que necesita para brndar un mejor servicio al publico y tener a sus clientes satisfechos por el buen trabajo realizado. Su meta continua siendo la de mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su madre con la manuntencion de la familia.
texts.en: Jose, 21, is single and lives in the municipality of Morazan, in the department of Yoro.  Jose has his own maintenance and repair workshop for motorcycles and moto-taxis.  He set it up 2 years and 5 months ago in a rented space.  He previously worked as a mechanic in another workshop, and it was there that he learned this trade very well.  He is requesting a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to buy tools, spare parts, motor oil, grease and additives that he needs to provide the best service to the public and keep his customers satisfied.  His goals are to continue to improve his house and to help his mother support the family.

loans.use: to buy tools, grease, and motor oil so that he can do maintenance work on motorcycles and moto-taxis

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu,  46, is a mother of four children and resides with her husband at Sinkor.  Her children are between the ages  of 4 and 15 and are currently in school. Bendu has been selling raw fish in the market for the past seven years. She makes profit when she sells because she always has her customers' favorite fish, cassava fish, and bonnie fish. With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods to increase her sales. She is requesting this loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business and hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts and additional salon equipment.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Nathaniel owns a shop selling diesel and petrol, a business that he has been running for six years. He also farms and has a transport business. Nathaniel learned of Milango from his friends and joined the group to access funds for his business. 

Nathaniel is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to purchase petrol and diesel for sale. The main challenges in his business are scarcity and the high cost of fuel, as well as the fluctuation of prices. He looks forward to setting up his own business premises instead of renting and also to opening up another fuel outlet.

Nathaniel will use the additional income from the loan to pay for his child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase petrol and diesel for sale.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es:
Clelia, de 55 años  y en la actualidad sigue cultivando sus terrenos, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Desde su infancia aprendió los conocimientos básicos de las tareas del campo, hace 22 años se independiza  y realiza estas tareas para el bienestar de su familia, sus principales cultivos son papa, trigo, cebada y habas que lleva en cada cosecha a los principales mercados de su zona y en cada época de siembra y de cosecha ella  lleva a personas que la puedan ayudar en esta tarea y les paga  a cada uno según la jornal realizada, aunque esta tarea sea muy agotadora  es la única fuente de sustento que permite solventar todos los costos masque nada para la educación de sus hijas, es por ello que para el futuro Clelia desea incrementar la extensión de su terrenos para seguir sembrando más cantidad de sus productos agrícolas. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Clelia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Clelia is 55 years old and makes a living cultivating her land. She lives with her two daughters in her own house.

She learned the basic knowledge of farm work when she was a child. 22 years ago, she became independent and began to carry out these tasks for the well-being of her family. Her principal crops are potatoes, wheat, barley, and beans, which she brings to the local market after every harvest. During the sowing and harvest seasons, she brings in people who can help her with the work and pays each of them depending on the hours they have put in. 

This work is exhausting, but it is the only means of support for her expenses, especially for the education of her daughters. For this reason, Clelia wishes to expand her land to continue sowing higher quantities of her agricultural products. 

She has been working as part of a group with the "Productores Huancas" communal bank, and this is her sixth credit with MFP. Her perseverance is admirable, as she is one of the longest-standing members of the group. She continues to renew her efforts and her positive attitude.

Clelia will invest this money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute during the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 62 años, es una mujer admirable. Enviudó hace 21 años, del que fue su esposo José, con quien tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Manuel en su casa propia. A pesar de criar sola a sus hijos, ella mantiene la misma fortaleza de siempre. Con la venta de verduras crió a sus hijos, de los que se siente orgullosa. Su trabajo es arduo, pues tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares y en días estratégicos, donde existe feria. Es así que de lunes a domingo trabaja sin descanso. Cuenta que ganan un promedio de 70 a 80 soles diarios. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir un lugar propio en el mercado de concepción de donde también vende. Por otro lado recibe el apoyo de su último hijo quien trabaja como albañil construyendo casa. Ahora desea abrir un negocio con el que pueda mantenerse sin preocupaciones por el resto de su vida.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las Wanquitas” y este es el crédito número 18 con MFP, donde está contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de verduras por canastas para su negocio en diferentes ciudades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 62 years old, is an admirable woman. She became a widow 21 years ago with the passing of her husband, José, with whom she had three children. She lives with one of her children, Manuel, in her own house.

Despite having raised her children alone, she remains as strong as ever. She is proud of the fact that she was able to raise her children by selling vegetables. Her work is arduous, as she needs to travel to different places on strategic days, when there are markets. She works from Monday to Sunday without a break.

She reports that she earns an average of 70 to 80 Peruvian soles per day. She was able to secure her own space in the market of Concepción, from which she makes sales. She also receives support from her youngest child, who works as a bricklayer constructing houses.

She would now like to open a business in order to maintain herself without any worries for the rest of her life. She is a member of the solidarity group "Las Wanquitas," and this is her eighteenth credit with MFP. She is happy with MFP because she will have financial support, which will allow her to feel secure moving forward with her work. She promises to comply with her payments. Furthermore, she enjoys being a part of her association, because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. 

Juana will invest this loan in the purchase of vegetables for her business, which she will buy by the basket in various cities in her area.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a resident of Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. Priscillar owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for four years. Priscillar began the business from a loan she obtained from a friend. She also sells milk.

Priscillar learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main business challenge is competition and the effect of low seasons.  

Priscillar is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard. She aspires to own other centers, pay for her children’s education, and achieve security.

loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits and groceries, e.g., oranges, passionfruit, limes, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old single young man. He works across the border and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his daily expenses and also pay his university fees.

Ibrahem is still studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Ibrahem wants to complete his studies by paying his university fees, so he is requesting a 700 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover these. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child.  Irene owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for five years. She began the business from the savings she obtained while working as a baby sitter. She desires to set up a grocery stall.

Irene learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and fluctuating prices. 

Irene is applying for a loan of 62,700 KES to purchase food stuffs like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, and produce. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's standard of living. She aspires to own other centers and to ensure her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Hussnie

texts.en:
Hussnie, a 48-year-old married father of three sons and three daughters ranging in age from 15 to 22-years old, raises and sells poultry. With strong demand from his customers, his is a profitable enterprise.

Hussnie is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture. Receiving this loan will enable Hussnie and his family to better enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, reside en compañía  de sus padres  en  una comunidad rural del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira.
