For the past  six years, Mercy has been selling (imported) blouses and slippers in the community market. She is proud of this business because she makes a profit and with the  profit, she buys more goods and contributes to the household income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more (imported) slippers and blouses for the business. Her plan is to buy land and build house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more (imported) slippers and blouses for the business.

loans.name: Sabiano

texts.en:
Sabiano is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one school-going child. 

Sabiano owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for three years. She is also employed as a sales agent and sells soaps.

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of capital for expansion, a problem she sees partly sorted by this loan.

Sabiano is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy raw materials for making soap. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the sources of income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making soap.

loans.name: Granja Los Tres Chanchitos Group

texts.es:
El Grupo solidario La granja los tres chanchitos esta conformado por tres personas emprendedoras que desean salir adelante trabajando en algo que les gusta como es la agricultura y la crianza de animalitos.

El Sr Adan es el presidente de este grupo, una persona joven con muchos valores eticos como el ser responsable, honrado y muy trabajador, valores inculcados por sus padres, es por estas acciones que su familia y vecinos lo quieren y lo aprecian mucho.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a utilizar en la compra de chanchitos para la crianza y la venta, ademas se utilizara en la adecuacion de sus chancheras ya que los chanchitos necesitan algunos cuidados es necesario tenerlos en un lugar adecuado.

El sueño que Adan tiene es comprarse un terreno grande, donde pueda tener una chanchera muy grande, y lograr ser un pequeño distribuidor para los mercados de su ciudad. Con estos ingresos ayudar a su madre y comprarle una casa para que viva con sus hermanos pequeños, mejorando la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The "La Granja los Tres Chanchitos" [The Three Little Piggies Farm] communal bank is made up of three enterprising people who want to get ahead by working in a field that they enjoy: agriculture and raising young animals.

Adan is the president of this group. He is a young man with strong ethics like being responsible, honest, and hardworking; these values were instilled in him by his parents, and they are why his family and neighbors love and appreciate him very much.

The loan requested from Fodemi will be used to purchase piglets to raise for sale. In addition, it will be used to improve the pens because piglets need to be cared for and kept in a suitable place. 

Adan's dream is to buy himself a large piece of land where he can have a very large pig farm and one day be a small distributor for the markets in his city. With those earnings, he would help his mother and buy her a house, because she lives with his little brothers. This would improve the quality of life of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and to upgrade the pens; they need to be improved because the pigs require a lot of care.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a food retail business where he supplies cakes to customers with his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a viable business market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of cake ingredients. He will use the Kes 35000 loan to buy food ingredients for baking cakes to sell. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a restaurant. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing cakes to supply to customers

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is a 43-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small farm and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. Lita has requested a loan to buy young piglets, barbed wire, pig food, and a wheelbarrow. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Lita hopes to re-furnish her entire house.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, young piglets, barbed wire, and pig food.

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesus

texts.es: Bernarda de 63 anos de edad, madre soltera con 4 hijos mayores de edad. Del departamento de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Bernarda tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, vestidos, ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes. El negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante, la rutina diaria de Bernarda es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto a clientes fijos y eventuales. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  con mercadería en esta temporada navideña para para satisfacer la demanda  de sus clientes. Y aumentar sus ganancias. Bernarda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 63 years old, and a single mother with four adult children. She is from the Chinandega department, a place located in the western part of the country. Bernarda's work is selling general merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, dresses, underwear, cosmetics and perfumes.

She carries on her business as a street vendor. Bernard's daily routine is working around 10 hours a day, offering her products to regular and occasional customers. She needs a loan to invest in working capital and to restock merchandise at this Christmas season. This is so that so that she can satisfy customer demand and increase her earnings. 

Bernarda is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors  offer to low-income people and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and restock her merchandise with products such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, dresses, underwear, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Ado-Gbagbe Group

texts.fr: ADO-GBAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Olive Kwessiba est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo, est âgée de 40 ans est mariée à Marc, un soudeur. Olive Kwessiba a un peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Olive Kwessiba et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage, Olive Kwessiba vend des fournitures de couture et des tissus dans un quartier du Bénin. Olive Kwessiba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Olive Kwessiba et les autres membres du groupe ADO-GBAGBE sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
ADO-GBAGBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  

The group's representative, Olive Kwessiba, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 40 years old and married to Marc, a welder.  She went to school for a brief period of time.  Olive Kwessiba and Marc have three children, all in school and their dependents.  They live with their children and jointly take care of the various household expenses.

In order to contribute to the family's various needs, Olive Kwessiba has been selling sewing supplies and fabrics in a neighborhood in Benin.  She stocks up at a market located in Benin.  Her activity allows her to meet her needs, as well as those of her children, without much difficulty.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Olive Kwessiba is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time, along with the other members of the ADO-GBAGBE group. This should help them to boost their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' expectations.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and fabrics.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: Carina lives in Ozamis City and helps her family through a manufacturing business, particularly the making of hollow blocks. She is a 37-year-old single woman with two children, who tries her best to earn on her own. For four years, she has managed this business and earns about 10,500 PHP per month. She would like to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. She joined this year and thanks Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative for the loan of 20,000 PHP. Carina wants to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment to expand their business

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Divino Nino el Sauce esta conformado por ocho integrantes originarios del departamento del Sauce, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país, El sauce se caracteriza por ser productor de leche, cuajada, crema. Estos integrantes son personas responsables casadas, con 12 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Todos trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal. Liduvina es la coordinadora del banco comunal ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual consiste en vender productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, tomates, condimentos, jugos, entre otros. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Liduvina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The community bank Divino Nino el Sauce is formed by eight members originally from the department of Sauce, located in the North part of the country, El Sauce is known for producing milk, cheese, cream.  These members are responsible people, married they have 12 children under their responsibility.  They are all hardworking with hopes to self-improve.  Liduvina is the coordinator of the community bank, her activity is a convenience store located in her house when and she sells basic products such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, sugar, tomatoes, condiments, juices and others.  The loan is needed to invest in working capital to stock her store and satisfy the demand from her clients.  Liduvina is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way to live.

loans.use: to stock her convenience store with products such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, sugar, tomatoes, condiments, juices.

loans.name: Blas Jr.

texts.en: Blas is a 34-year old resident of Naga, Jimenez. Blas provides his two children's needs from the little amount of 8,000 PHP he gains monthly from his own piggery business. He has been in business for three years. However just recently he's become a member of GDMPC. He applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 20,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Blas wants to make an expansion to his business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for his pigs.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 43 year old married woman and a mother of nine children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business and seaweed farming. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Andresa is requesting a loan to buy materials for fishing, such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Andresa hopes of improving their business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Elpedia has been in this business for nine years. Elpedia earns more income from farming banana and rice.

Elpedia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: Buenos días. Este es el Grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” conformada por 09 mujeres emprendedoras. Elia tiene 30 años casada, con 02 hijos menores de edad. Elia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, comenzó hace más de 01 año, actualmente habilito un espacio en su vivienda donde ofrece dichos productos. Este negocio surgió con la idea de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Con el crédito que solicito invertirá en productos de belleza, en la compra de perfumes, joyas, cremas y talcos. Su sueño de Elia es tener una boutique, ya que de este modo tendrá mayores ganancias .Elia está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo manga larga de color celeste.
texts.en: Hello. This is the group "El Esfuerzo Es Grande" (The Effort is Great), which is made up of nine enterprising women. Elia is 30 years old and married, with two children who are minors. Elia makes a living by selling beauty products. She began over a year ago. Currently she uses a space in her house to offer said products. This business started with the idea of improving her family's quality of lfie. She will invest the requested loan in beauty products - in the purchase of perfumes, jewellery, creams, and talcum powders. Elia's dream is to have a boutique, as it will give her greater profits. Elia is at the back of the photo. She is the first from the left, in the sky-blue shirt with long sleeves.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, jewellery, creams, and talcum powders.

loans.name: Juarlito

texts.en: Juarlito is a 44-year old resident of Matugas Alto, Jimenez. Juarlito supports his family's needs from the little amount of 3,000 he gains monthly from his banana and coconut business. He has been in business for five years. However, in 2011 he became a member of GDMPC. He applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Juarlito wants to make an expansion to his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stocks and supplies to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items and supplies  to sell.

loans.name: Afiavi Bricette's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Afiavi Bricette la responsable, âgée de 38ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Les deux enfants ont respectivement 09ans et 06ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des plateaux d'œufs frais depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne auprès des grands éleveurs de volailles depuis quelques années. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Bricette se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who are taking a loan together, offering mutual guarantee to each other.

The group's representative, Afiavi Bricette, is 38 years old.  She is married, and the mother of two children who both attend school.  Her children are 9 and 6 years old.

She has been specializing in the sale of fresh eggs for a few years, and she buys egg trays from major poultry farmers.

Eager to increase her capital and to fulfill her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.  This will help her to maximize her supplementary income and to contribute to her children's school fees.

Bricette is featured in the left-hand side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 50 egg trays.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian a 47 years old, married, and has five children. She is from San Roque, Pana-on. To make a living, Vivian grows coconuts and bananas to sell. She has been doing this for two years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month. Vivian is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Vivian joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 63 years old and married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Nenita has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to aid the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Milagros has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is buying the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Milagros is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria. She is 48, and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Santiago, who works abroad, and a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Maria operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise like jackets, polo, shirts and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maria hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like varsity jacket, shirts, polo and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gloria has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a new fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. She is 44 and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Macario, a porter, and a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like jackets, polo shirts, blouses, shirts and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Josephine hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have their own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise like jackets, blouses, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cake in her community. To do this, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy foam cups, sacks of sugar,cordials,. In the future, Matalena hopes to save her profits for her children's education and betterment of her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: foam cups, sugar, cordials,

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru: Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Наталья увеличила свой доход и смогла приобрести бытовую технику для своего домашнего хозяйства. В последнее время в ее бизнесе наметился переход на товар больших размеров. В этот раз Наталя просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку женских свитеров и курток. Наталья по-прежнему помогает своему сыну оплачивать учебу в колледже. Ее мечта - поехать на зимний отдых в горы на Западну Украину со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, Natalia has increased her income and was able to purchase a few household appliances for her home.

Lately, Natalia's business has been shifting toward selling clothing of larger sizes. This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase women's sweaters and coats. 

As before, Natalia is helping to pay her son's college tuition. Her dream is to go on a winter vacation with her family to the mountains in western Ukraine.

loans.use: to stock up on women's sweaters and coats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in laminating pictures like plywood , chemicals used in lamination

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more banana chips to resell.

loans.name: Avavili

texts.en: Avavili is a 66-year-old married woman with three children. She would like to start a cattle farm to earn a living. Avavili has requested a loan to buy a cow in order for her to start a cattle farm. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Avavili will spend her profits to expand and improve her cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow, hammer, and nails

loans.name: Sarojini Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2008, 10 women from Balugaon village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Sarojini Self Help Group. The members of Sarojini Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Sarojin, who was selected as their president. The lady in the blue saree sitting first from the left hand side in the photo is Sarojin. Sarojin is 47 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on leadership of the group and started to cultivate paddy and sell them in her village. She has very good relationships with her customers as she sells paddy or rice, whichever is required by the customers, on time. Now she has a new idea, which is to lease more land for cultivation so that she can do paddy cultivation on a large scale. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for leasing farm land

loans.name: Tamalii

texts.en: Tamalii is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing plantation to earn a living. Tamalii has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Tamalii will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru: Сергей давно в бизнесе, но это направление начал сравнительно недавно. Он продает и обслуживает электронасосы, с помощью которых осуществляется полив овощей в теплицах. Большинство огородников старается отремонтировать или обновить систему полива к сезону. Сергей просит предоставить ему кредит на закупку партии электронасово и запчастей к ним. Он надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Sergei sells and services electric pumps used to irrigate greenhouse vegetables. He is a long-time entrepreneur, but has entered this particular line of work relatively recently.

Most farmers and gardeners try to repair or renew their irrigation systems prior to a new growing season. Sergei is requesting a loan to purchase a shipment of electrical pumps and their spare parts. He hopes to increase his profits and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase electric pumps used for greenhouse irrigation, as well as spare parts

loans.name: Leativa

texts.en:
Leativa  is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Leativa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, veggie seeds, shovels, an axe and sprayers. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Leativa hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheel barrow, shovels and gloves.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer esta conformado por 10 integrantes, todos casados, con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes son originario del departamento del Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de productos lácteos. Alba Justina es la coordinadora del banco comunal  Nuevo amanecer ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se venden productos de consumo diario para el hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, condimentos, jugos, tiste, entre otros. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería. El banco comunal nuevo amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank is made up of 10 members. They are all married and between them have 15 children under their care. These members are from the Sauce department; a place which is situated in the northern part of the country. Sauce is known for being an area that produces dairy products. 

Alba Justina is the coordinator of the Nuevo Amanecer communal bank. She has a small shop in her house which sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, condiments, juices and tiste (a pre-Colombian drink made of cocoa and corn). The finance that she needs is to buy products to stock her shop.

Nuevo Amanecer communal bank thanks Kiva investors for their help as it offers dignified work to people with scarce resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her small shop with various products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has an electronics retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and  works hard to support her family.

Jocelyn has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her shop. In the future, she would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joann works hard to support her family and has been in this business for four years.

Joann has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is from Tabo-o, Jimenez. She is 47 years old and is married with five children. To make a living, Emelia sells fish while her husband does the fishing. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Emelia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru: Предыдущий кредит помог Оксане закупить большое количество товара по низкой цене и получить дополнительную прибыль. В этот раз Оксана также планирует закупить продукты питания - муку, сахар, спагетти и пр. - для реализации в своем магазине. В семье Оксаны произошни положительние изменения - ее дочь вышла замуж и Оксана уже успела стать бабушкой. В остальном - все стабильно и постояенно.
texts.en:
Her previous loan helped Oksana to make a bulk purchase of foodstuffs at low prices and make additional profits. This time, she also plans to stock up on food - flour, sugar, spaghetti, etc. - for sale in her shop.

Oksana's family has gone through exciting changes - her daughter got married, and Oksana is already a grandmother. Everything else has been smooth and steady.

loans.use: to stock up on flour, sugar, spaghetti and other food products

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is married and the mother of eight children. She is 47 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez. Nelfa is a farmer who has been planting and selling vegetables to earn a living for four years. She delivers vegetables like leafy vegetables and eggplant to the local market. She earns 3,000 PHP each month from this work. 

Nelfa has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Nelfa hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 50, is a resident of Bacoor, Philippines and is the mother of her children. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to pay her everyday expenses.  

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then delivered to the customer with one-month's credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, which is how profits are earned by the dealers who invest in this way to earn their income. Elizabeth's  regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her to continue operating her business, Elizabeth is requesting a loan of  50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments, etc. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of her family having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments, etc. to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabrics for making school and office uniforms

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and, in addition, earns  income from raising livestock and selling food.

Josephine is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle's maintenance so she can operate her transport business. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle's maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to add to her business.

loans.name: B & B Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “B and B” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 2,800,000 Leones for the group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Jatu. Jatu is age 32; she was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing together with her husband and six children. Her husband is a motor mechanic, and five of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For 20 years, Jatu has been a businesswoman. She makes and sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloth). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gara lapper-making materials, like white cotton cloth, ink, caustic soda, and powder, in order to produce a larger quantity of gara cloth for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials, like white cotton cloth, ink, caustic soda, and powder, in order to produce a larger quantity of gara lappers (dyed cloth) to sell.

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
The photo shows the two members of the Kara Group. They are small scale business women based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones. With the help of this loan, these ladies will be able to further expand on the quality and quantity of their respective businesses.  

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is 48 years old. She was born in Makeni, where she currently resides with her husband and four children. Her husband is an electrician and her children attend primary and secondary school. Aminata sells clothes – gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and Bamako clothes (clothes dyed in Mali). She has been a business woman for 25 years now. With this loan, she is going to buy gara lapper making materials like ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. for the production of large quantities of gara clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton clothes, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of locally dyed clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
These borrowers are primary school teachers in Wellington, which is on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. School teachers are among the lowest-paid workers in Sierra Leone. The majority, therefore, has to do extra work in order to make ends meet. Salone Microfinance Trust in partnership with Kiva is very helpful in mitigating the problems of teachers. Salone Microfinance Trust offered “Salary Loans” to teachers and other government workers in all SMT's operational areas. These loans help them solve their immediate financial challenges and, at the end of each month, they can easily repay their loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 
Their leader is Abu Bakarr.. The 52 year old man is a native of Yoni village in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and together they have 6 children who are attending schools. Abu Bakarr has been a teacher for many years now. He has requested for a loan of 2,600,000 Leones in order to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
In the photo is Mohamed, a small-scale businessman based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, he will be able to expand his businesses, make more profit and consequently improve his standard of living. 

Mohamed is aged 34; he was born in Kenema city where he is currently residing together with his wife and two children. For six years now, Mohamed has been selling used shoes and used bags. With this loan, he will buy bales of used shoes and bags to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of used shoes and bags to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her business's maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 21-year-old son. She has been a cleaner at a training center since 2000. Before that, she worked as a nurse at the Children’s Hospital. Her family lives in a small wooden house in the ger district, an area with no running water, minimal roads and erratic electricity, in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world and borders with Siberia to the north. So they need to use more coal to stay warm which is why Mongolia is one of the worst countries for air pollution. 

Oyuntsetseg is planning to to prevent heat loss from her house by thickening the walls with materials such as cement,  brick, and glass wool (fiberglass) batts. She is therefore  requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to thicken her house walls.

loans.use: to prevent heat loss from her house by thickening the walls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hardware products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 32 years old and is the mother of 3 children between the ages of 8 and 15 years old; They are all going to school. She runs a clothing business in Torkpoi town Bo, in the Southern area of Sierra Leone.

Lucy has been in this business for 10 years. She sells female and male clothes within her environment. Her husband is also a businessman but his income is not enough to support the home. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and increase her inventory. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is married, 58 years old, and lives in the community of Airport, along with her husband and five children. All of her children, who are between the ages of 12 and 25, are in school. Since 1997, Julia has been selling lappa (traditional clothes), slippers, shirts, and other items in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned her selling techniques from her mother. The main challenge she faces is the rainy season. Julia is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (traditional clothes), slippers, shirts, and other items for her business. Her future plans include building a house and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothes), slippers, shirts, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children aged 14, 11, 9 and 2 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling.  

In 2002, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Kadiatu now requires a new loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and rice by the bag for resale and to pay the transport costs. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to earns more profit, educate her children up to the university level, build houses and get another international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Handful

texts.en: Handful,  39,  lives together  with  her  friend and two  children at  Congo  Town. Her children   are  2 and 8 and attend school. Handful   has a table in the market where  she has  been selling rice, Vita, cooking oil, salt, onions, tomatoes, palm oil, and peppers for the past seven years. She started this business with a little income that she had been saving with a saving  club. She makes   profit when she sells. With the profit  generated from the business she buys  more   goods  to increase  her sales. She has requested a loan to purchase more Vita, cooking oil,  salt, onions, palm oil, and rice for  the  business. Her future plan  is to educate her children and build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase more Vita, cooking oil,  salt, onions, palm oil, and rice for  her  business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba, age 40, lives with her husband and a child who is 19 years old. Her husband is a security guard. 

For the past ten years, Kumba has been managing her business. She sells various products including bread, mayonnaise, sardines, biscuits, bath soap, washing soap and hair oil. She learned to sell from her mother. A challenge she faces is the low sales volume of her business, because of too little capital to buy inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more mayonnaise, biscuits, sardines, hair oil and bath soap, to increase her sales. 

Her plan for the future is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more mayonnaise, biscuits, sardines, hair oil and bath soap, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia, aged 51, is a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She and her children manage their household while she operates her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cynthia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only the usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and food costs less than raw ingredients. 

Cynthia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help Cynthia to continue operating her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Cynthia hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
В этом году Александр приобрел автомобиль, на котором он может вывозить продукцию на рынок. Раньше вместе с женой они возили овощи на тачке, что было тяжело, или сдавали по низкой цене. Теперь, могут вывезти на рынок или даже в ближайший большой город и продавать свою продукцию по хорошей цене, получая дополнительную прибыль.

Кредит нужен для закупки семян и пленки для теплиц. Алесандр уже сделал отопление в теплице, что позволит сохранить весь урожай весной во время заморозков, а значит получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Earlier this year, Alexander bought an automobile that he can use to transport his produce to the market. Previously, he and his wife carried their vegetables in a wheelbarrow, which was difficult, or sold them at lower prices. Now, they can take their harvest to the market or even to a nearby large city and sell it at a better price, thereby making additional profits.

This new loan is needed to purchase seeds and plastic covering for the greenhouses. Alexander has already installed a heating system in one greenhouse, which will allow him to preserve his whole harvest during spring frosts, and will increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and greenhouse covering

loans.name: Nuri 5 Group

texts.en:
Wasti, 47 years old, has two children, one of them already working, while the other is still in elementary school. Wasti sells "Lontong Sayur" a traditional  Indonesian food consisting of steamed rice wrapped in banana leaves that is eaten with coconut milk cooked in seasonings. The location of her business is in front of her house. 
So far her business is running well and she can save a little of her profits after she meets the needs of her family and pays school fees. She need the loan to repair her stand's table since it is already broken.

When not at her kiosk, she sometimes serves people in the neighbourhood who need her help to cook, usually for a wedding party. Wasti has a plan to establish a food stall near the crowded street near her house.

loans.use: to repair her stand which is damaged, to buy rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is taking out a new loan for her business of selling charcoal.She says that she is also in her clothes selling business. Both businesses are doing well. She is grateful for the previous loan that had a positive impact on her living standards.This current loan will enable her to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to sell. She hopes to increase her sales via this investment.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en:
Idd, 27, is a very responsible young man who is dedicated to maintaining the welfare of his family. He is a father of one young child. 

Idd has a business selling ice cream door-to-door. At times, he sells in the restaurants. He lives in a town where there is no great competition, which is very good for his earnings.

He is requesting a loan to be able to buy water and food colors.

loans.use: to buy water and food colors.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Adelaida, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continua dedicándose al comercio de artesanía, principalmente de joyería en plata, Adelaida vende su mercadería en los principales mercados artesanales de la ciudad , mayormente para el mercado turístico de la ciudad.
Adelaida esta solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su comercio y comprar mercadería como aretes, collares, pulseras, anillos y accesorios de plata para la próxima campaña navideña.
Adelaida Está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su actividad, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
This member, Adelaida, belongs to the "Los Diamantes" ("Diamonds") communal bank based in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues to run her business trading handicrafts, mainly silver jewelry. Adelaida sells her merchandise at major craft markets in the city, in particular the main tourist market.

Adelaida is applying for this loan to capitalize on her trade and buy merchandise for the upcoming holiday season, such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, and silver accessories.

Adelaida is very grateful to Kiva for the support and assistance she has received to keep her business going. Her work is the main source of income and livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Alberto pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Alberto continúa dedicándose al rubro de la construcción civil en el lugar que lo solicite, y es con su trabajo que saca adelante a su familia, Alberto  necesita renovar algunas herramientas de trabajo, por ello el socio está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una cortadora de cerámicos y accesorios como guantes y gafas de trabajo.
Alberto Está muy agradecido con KIVA por el apoyo que económicamente le proporciona para el mantenimiento de su actividad, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This member, Alberto, belongs to the communal bank "Los Diamantes" ("Diamonds") based in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues to run his civil construction business, which is how he is able to support his family. 

Alberto needs to replace some of his tools, therefore he is requesting a loan to purchase a ceramic cutter and accessories such as gloves and goggles.

Alberto is very grateful for the financial support that Kiva provides, which enables him to continue in his business. He agrees to comply with the payment schedule and to be punctual with repayments.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 28 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc..

Joylyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Joylyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia works hard to support her family. Julia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julia has requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Julia has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Julia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is Veronica, 52, and a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Veronica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting her supplies at wholesale prices and reselling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a Php32,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Veronica dreams of having a good life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs.Sarantuya is a 59 year old widow who lives alone in her Ger in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her children have gotten married and moved out of her house. She has been working as tailor in private tailoring company for years and gained experience in tailoring various types of clothes especially the Mongolian traditional costume known as Deel. She is now planning to operate a tailoring service at her home. She has a tailoring machine and space for her business. She has started getting orders from her friends and relatives and she needs some inventory to build her business. She is requesting 800'000MNT to purchase inventory to run her newly started business. She is a positive, friendly and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run her newly started business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment for her farm.

Lolita has been farming vegetables for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment for her farm

loans.name: José Aben

texts.es:
El señor se dedica a la actividad de barbería desde hace 6 años, esa actividad la aprendía por herencia su padre era el que tenia esta actividad y posteriormente con préstamo inicio su propia actividad, es casado y tiene dos niñas motivo por el cual se esfuerza  por sacarlas adelante.

En su barbería también poco a poco ha venido invirtiéndole productos de golosinas y refrescos  el es un señor muy esforzado poco a poco ha venido saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
This gentleman, José Aben, has had his barbershop for 6 years. He learned the trade from his father, and after taking out a loan he was able to start his own business. José Aben is married with two daughters, who are his motivation to succeed. 

Gradually, José Aben has started to sell refreshments and sodas in his barbershop. He is a very determined gentleman who has been steadily moving forward with his business.

loans.use: to run his barbershop

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Lamin from Waterloo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. He is married with two children between the ages of two and five years old. One of his children is currently attending school. In 2000, Lamin established his local foodstuff business within a busy market area. He began his business because he came from an extended family and he has no one to support him. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 8:30 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient capital to run his business.

Lamin requires a loan in order to buy beans, palm oil, pepper and groundnuts. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and improve his standard of living. In the future, Lamin plans to build a business structure of his own. The woman feature in the video is the SEP loan officer from the Waterloo branch.  He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Lamin from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy beans, palm oil, pepper and groundnuts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 42, and live in Compound#3 (a town in Grand Bassa County, Liberia) with her husband and two children. The youngest child is  6 months old and the oldest one is 24. Victoria has a table adjacent to a supermarket, where she has been selling oranges, bananas, pineapples, and cucumbers for the past four years. She makes profit when she sells, because as customers go in and out of the supermarket; they stop at her table to buy. She learned to sell from her mother and started with a little amount that she received from her husband.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges, bananas, and plums for the business. Her plan is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges, bananas, and plums for the business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 34 years old, married, and has been blessed with two children.  He is a very hardworking and ambitious man who has to provide for his family.  He has been in this business for five years and has managed to expand his business through the financial help of Faulu Kenya.  Someday, he hopes to have a stable business.  He requests a loan of 105,300 KES to buy three bulls for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy three bulls for slaughter.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. He has seven children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding dairy cows to improve their productivity!' His biggest challenge is 'High cost of animal feeds and diseases..' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelmet'. He says he will use the loan requested, amounting to 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Patrick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because I am a farmer and Juhudi Kilimo offers loans to small-scale farmers to boost their farming activities.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Micro finance is short-term loans given to people who do small-scale farming and businesses.'

Patrick's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Patrick replied, 'My children will go to school due to the money from selling milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Patrick owns the following: 'cow, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a widow parent of six children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-selling business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Sonia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice-selling business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag is a 27-year-old divorced woman who lives with her son in a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her 4-year-old son, Shine-Erdene, goes to a local kindergarten school. She has been operating a retail clothes business for two years. She has already built a strong customer base and supplier base. She imports clothes from Erlian, China. During her travels, she leaves her son with her parents. 

Mrs. Tungalag is building a small, energy-efficient house for herself and her son. She needs an additional investment of 500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials and windows. She is a hardworking and strong woman who says, "My son and I will live happily in our new warm house during the winters."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and windows for her house.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding-shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her welding-shop business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. Mary Ann earns additional income from a general store and raising chickens.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her welding shop.

loans.name: Marybel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marybel works hard to support her family.

She has a ambulant vending dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Marybel is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Marybel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es: La señora es comerciante desde hace 6 años del mercado de Chinandega, su actividad es venta de pescado fresco y seco, camarón, conchas etc. Es una señora que se esfuerza por salir adelante vende de lunes a sábado desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, de ella dependen dos hijos que están estudiando la  secundaria, poco a poco ha mejorado su calidad de vida pero ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda y  darles una mejor condición a toda su familia con mucho esfuerzo, se siente bastante agradecida con los financiamientos que le hemos brindado ya que ella siente que su negocio ha venido incrementando y  sus ganancias .
texts.en: This woman has been a merchant for 6 years in the Chinandega market. Her activity is selling fresh and dried fish, shrimp, oysters, etc. She is a woman who works hard to get ahead Monday through Saturday from five in the morning until four in the afternoon. Her two children depend on her; they are in secondary school. Little by little, she has improved her quality of life, but she dreams of finishing construction on her house and giving her whole family a better quality of life with a lot of hard work. She is very grateful for the loans that we have offered her because hse feels that her business has grown and so have her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Tuvshin

texts.en:
Tuvshin, who is 47 years old, lives with his wife and his son in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife Delhiitsetseg, age of 47, works as saleswoman at local bookstore. His son works at a gas station as assistant worker. 

Tuvshin has been producing ice-cream out of organic milk from cattle since 2003. He is famous in the area and his business is stable. He is planning to purchase another ice-cream machine for his business. He is now requesting 600'000 MNT to purchase the ice-cream machine for his organic ice-cream production business. He is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy an ice-cream machine for his organic ice-cream production business.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Amor de Mujeres esta conformado por 16 integrantes, casados, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son personas trabajadoras, responsables, humilde, con ganas de superación personal para salir adelante con sus hijos. Ellos son originarios del departamento del Sauce, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche.  Meylin es la coordinadora del banco comunal Amor de Mujeres ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de leche y cuajada en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de leche. El banco comunal Amor de Mujeres agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Mujeres" is composed of sixteen members, all married. In total, the members have 20 children. They are hardworking, responsible and humble women, with a strong will to thrive and get ahead in life with their children. They come from the Sauce region, located in the north of the country. The region is known for its milk production.

Meylin is the coordinator of this communal bank. She sells milk and cottage cheese, both at home and as a street vendor. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business with milk. The communal bank "Amor de Mujeres" appreciates the help provided by Kiva lenders, because thanks to them, people with less economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua have access to decent sources of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock her business.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. Este es el grupo  “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” con 08 integrantes, que pasan a su 5to ciclo, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Julia es viuda y tiene 03 hijos independientes. A sus 58 años Julia ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y a ayudar a sus hijos en su educación. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y chupetes en las afueras de un colegio, sus mayores clientes son  alumnos de dicho colegio. Seguir mejorando su vivienda es su mayor deseo. Con el crédito que solicito comprará una cocina y frutas para la preparación de chupetes.  El grupo “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” está agradecido y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Julia se encuentra de pie es la cuarta del lado izquierdo tiene  polo  color negro y pantalón azul.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru. This is the “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” [Unity Makes Strength]  group, with 8 members. They are in their 5th cycle, and the large majority of them are residents of the area. Julia is a widow and has 3 grown children. At 58 years old, Julia has been able to acheive some of her dreams, such as improving her home and helping her children get an education. Right now she sells gelatin and lollipops outside of a high school. Most of her customers come from the high school. To keep improving her home is her biggest wish. With the loan she asked for, she will buy a stove and some fruit to make her lollipops. The “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” group is grateful and committed to continuing to work well with Programa- Prosperidad. Julia is standing and is the fourth one from the left. She has on a black shirt on and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy a stove and some fruit.

loans.name: Ninoska Maricielo

texts.es: Ninoska tiene 20 años. Ella estudia la carrera de Terapia Física y  Rehabilitación en una Universidad local, sus estudios duran 05 años y le falta 03 años para graduarse, cuando culmine su carrera  le gustaría trabajar  en un hospital o clínica de prestigio para poder ayudar a muchas personas, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo usara para pagar la pensión de un semestre, considera que su préstamo es de mucha ayuda para continuar con sus estudios, ya que la parte económica muchas veces es un obstáculo para muchos jóvenes que quieren estudiar. Ninoska esta agradecida a los inversionistas de Kiva por apoyarla en sus estudios.
texts.en: Ninoska is 20 years old. She studies physical therapy and rehabilitation at a local university. Her major lasts for five years and she has three more years to go until graduation. When she finishes her studies she would like to work in a prestigious hospital or clinic to be able to help a lot of people. The loan she has asked for will be used to pay for a semster's tuition. She considers the loan to be a big help for continuing her studies, since the financial part is aften a big obstacle for a lot of young people who want to study. Ninoska is grateful to the Kiva investors for helping her with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semseter's tuition.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 36 años es un hombre sencillo. Vive en compañía de su esposa Alicia, con quién tiene 2 hijas: Lisbeth y Noemí, a las que cuida en la casa que le heredó su padre hace 15 años. Como hijo de campo, que nació y compartió su vida entre las personas que viven de la crianza de animales y producción de la tierra. Él también comparte por más de 10 años la siembra de diversos productos agrícolas, en principal maíz; pues le rinde buenas ganancias. Pero la principal actividad económica de Alberto, se centra en la crianza de animales como vacas y cerdos en cantidad, comenta que por la cantidad de animales que posee los lleva a criar en las alturas de los cerros, donde puede alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales. Después de alimentarlos y cuando se encuentren maduros los comercializa en la ciudad, donde vende como carne. Pero hay días en los obtiene compradores en el mismo lugar de crianza, “esos son días en los que obtengo más ganancias, pues vendo a un mayor precio”, afirma. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, agradece al poyo recibido en este corto tiempo, pues le ayudó a obtener el capital necesario para emprender su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Alberto, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias cabezas de cerdos para mejorar la producción de su ganado.
texts.en:
Alberto is 36 years old and a down to earth man. He lives with his wife Alicia, with whom he has 2 daughters: Lisbeth and Noemí. He takes care of them in the house he inherited from his father 15 years ago. 

A child of the countryside, he was born and bred among people who live by rearing animals and cultivating the land. For more than 10 years he has planted various agricultural products, mostly corn; it brings him good profits. But Alberto's main economic activity is the rearing of animals like cows and pigs in large quantities. He says that as he has so many animals he breeds them high up in the hills, where he can feed them on natural pastures.

After feeding them, and when they have become mature, he takes them to market in the city, where he sells them as meat. But sometimes he finds buyers in the same place that he breeds the animals. "These are the days that I make the most profits, as I sell at a higher price", he declares. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support received in this short time, as it has helped him raise the capital necessary to undertake his business. For this reason he promises to be punctual in the payment of his instalments. 

Alberto will invest the money in the purchase of some pigs to improve the output of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy some pigs

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 60 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Lucio, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que criaron con mucho amor; ahora ellos viven con su nieta en una casa alquilada.   
Ya no tiene hijos a quienes cuidar, todo ellos son grandes y maduros; se siente orgullosa. Pero tiene que trabajar junto a su esposo para poder mantenerse y no brindar preocupaciones además de criar a su nieta. El trabajo al que se dedica es la siembra de maíz, papa y alfalfa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida constantemente, ya en la cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes fijos. Asimismo su esposo recibe una pensión por la jubilación de su trabajo, con el tiempo ahorro dinero para comprar un auto, ahora trabaja como taxista en el trasporte público entre dos ciudades cercanas, saco todo los permisos ahora solo le falta uno para poder trabajar con tranquilidad, obtiene buenas ganancias de su trabajo, porque es su propio auto y así obtiene mejores ingresos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.Reyna, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de Abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 60 years old, and she is a wise woman.  She lives with Lucio, her husband of 17 years. They have seven children who they raised with great love, and they now live with their granddaughter in a rented house.

Reyna doesn't look after any of her children now, because they have all grown up, and this makes her feel proud. But she and her husband still have to work  to support themselves and raise their granddaughter without any other worries. She makes a living growing corn, potatoes and alfalfa on her own land, which she always takes good care of. During harvest time, she sells her produce in the wholesale market in the city, where she has regular customers. 

In addition to this, her husband receives a pension from the job he did before he retired. Over time, he saved up to buy a car, and now works as a public transport taxi driver between two nearby cities. He has obtained all the necessary licenses and he only needs one more in order to work with peace of mind. The job pays well because he uses his own car, which means he makes more profit. 

Reyna belongs to the "San Lorenzo" support group, and this is their thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is hoping for a small loan which will allow her to achieve her goals. She promises to meet her loan repayments, just as she did with the last loan she received. She enjoys being part of the association because all its members are responsible and supportive. Reyna will use the money she has requested to buy organic compost to put on her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mechill works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Mechill is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Mechill has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 36 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Merly has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and chickens. She aspires to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Petisi

texts.en:
Petisi is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years.
